deed.name: Lore of the Blade
deed.description:
The first four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Angmar, Eregion, and Moria. The last four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Forochel, Moria, and the Misty Mountains.

Lore of the Blade seems to be a rather unusual tome for a Lore-master to express interest in. Rather than delving deeply into the hidden mysteries of mountains, or discussing at length the habits of wave and wind, it reads more like a rousing tale of adventure written to entertain hobbit-children. The pages of Lore of the Blade claim to follow the adventures of a brave young Lore-master who when confronted with deadly dangers is just as apt to fight her way through with flashing swordplay as to confound her opponents with the lore of the elements or the wisdom of long forgotten sages. Oddly, as you find yourself drawn into the stirring tale you begin to see the more subtle nuances of the story unfold through the eyes of its character, who displays an uncanny insight into the nature of the foes she faces, and an understanding of when the strength of arms applied at the correct moment may indeed be the least destructive course.

Unfortunately, some prior reader has handled this copy rather poorly and some of the pages are torn beyond repair. The author also proves to be a bit difficult to pin down, as he has chosen to identify himself solely by the runic letter 'G' inscribed on the binding.
deed.objectives: Collect Lore of the Blade Talk to Gandalf in Rivendell Collect Lore of the Blade, Page 5 Collect Lore of the Blade, Page 11 Collect Lore of the Blade, Page 18 Collect Lore of the Blade, Page 26 Collect Lore of the Blade, Page 35 Collect Lore of the Blade, Page 45 Collect Lore of the Blade, Page 56 Collect Lore of the Blade, Page 68

deed.name: The Book of Beasts
deed.description:
The first four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Angmar, Eregion, and Moria. The last four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Forochel, Moria, and the Misty Mountains.

It is unclear who wrote this book as no author's name is given, but the clarity and wisdom with which it is written only adds further to the mystery of its apparently modest writer. The Book of Beasts speaks at great length of the bonds which may be formed between creatures of the wilds and those among the Free Peoples of Middle-earth who are willing to understand their own true natures. It further claims that the Wise might even learn the tongues of the wild creatures of the world and may coax them to greater feats of bravery and strength than would otherwise be possible for a beast lacking in its own will to strive and accomplish.

Whomever transcribed this particular copy, alas, does not appear to have been entirely in his right mind. Most of the text is clear, but some few of the pages are written in a hopeless scrawl with no meaning in any language of Elves or Men that you can discern. Indeed, it seems as if the scribe must have been taken with fits of madness during these passages. Perhaps Elrond of Rivendell might be able to tell you more about the mysterious author and help you untangle the riddle of the meaningless passages.
deed.objectives: Collect The Book of Beasts Talk to Elrond at the Last Homely House in Rivendell Collect The Book of Beasts, Page 3 Collect The Book of Beasts, Page 6 Collect The Book of Beasts, Page 8 Collect The Book of Beasts, Page 14 Collect The Book of Beasts, Page 25 Collect The Book of Beasts, Page 26 Collect The Book of Beasts, Page 33 Collect The Book of Beasts, Page 37

deed.name: Of Leaf and Twig
deed.description:
The first four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Angmar, Eregion, and Moria. The last four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Forochel, Moria, and the Misty Mountains.

This is a strange book indeed. The covers are crafted from strips of some fibrous bark supple enough to be woven together, while the pages themselves appear to be birch bark pounded carefully flat and gently inscribed with runic letters in dense rows, page after page. What magic can have allowed such a fragile-looking tome to survive time and age, you cannot guess. Nor have you ever seen a book of such length, for its author goes into each subject and sentence with such painstaking detail that you cannot imagine how long it must have taken to record it all in this fashion. The subject appears to be anything with roots and leaves. There is such an enormous breadth of knowledge concerning root, leaf, bark, and twig that you could likely study it for years without understanding it all.

To your ire, someone or something has carefully removed a few of the pages from the volume, leaving you to wonder what hidden lore they must have contained. Perhaps the master of the Last Homely House could shed some light on this mysterious tome -- you can think of few others who might.
deed.objectives: Collect Of Leaf and Twig Talk to Elrond at the Last Homely House in Rivendell Collect Of Leaf and Twig, Page 8 Collect Of Leaf and Twig, Page 23 Collect Of Leaf and Twig, Page 53 Collect Of Leaf and Twig, Page 77 Collect Of Leaf and Twig, Page 98 Collect Of Leaf and Twig, Page 145 Collect Of Leaf and Twig, Page 162 Collect Of Leaf and Twig, Page 241

deed.name: Melodies of the Valar
deed.description:
The first four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Angmar, Eregion, and Moria. The last four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Forochel, Moria, and the Misty Mountains.

It is said in the most ancient of tales that the world was formed in a great chorus of song, but this story is ancient and shrouded in myth even to the oldest among the living Elves, and no one in Middle-earth today could claim to know the truth of it. Towards the end of the Second Age, during the War of the Last Alliance, there was born a fair woman who sang in such wonderous tones that even the Elves would stop and listen in silence for so long as she would sing for them. Stranger still, she had no teaching in song or music, and yet could compose such melodies as to bring tears to the powerful and the Wise. She claimed that she composed no songs, and that she was simply trying to duplicate a music that she could hear -- a music that she claimed arose from the world itself, from mountains, streams, wind, and tree alike, in infinite variety.

Melodies of the Valar is the book that contains these songs as the Elves transcribed them, but most of the copies of this book have been taken away into the West, and very few remain in Middle-earth today. Alas, this one has been damaged, but an Elven minstrel of renown might well be able to shed some light on the matter.
deed.objectives: Collect Melodies of the Valar Talk to Lindir at the Last Homely House in Rivendell Collect Melodies of the Valar, Page 12 Collect Melodies of the Valar, Page 14 Collect Melodies of the Valar, Page 23 Collect Melodies of the Valar, Page 24 Collect Melodies of the Valar, Page 27 Collect Melodies of the Valar, Page 29 Collect Melodies of the Valar, Page 30 Collect Melodies of the Valar, Page 32

deed.name: The Rising Chord
deed.description:
The first four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Angmar, Eregion, and Moria. The last four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Forochel, Moria, and the Misty Mountains.

The Rising Chord is considered to be a remarkable collection of songs all of a theme that speaks to the heart of the Free Peoples of Middle-earth in one voice, be they Men, Elves, or dwarves. Drawing on the tradition of each of these peoples, the songs resound with a clarion call of freedom and hope that is unsullied by the slightest trace of sorrow, fear, or hate. There are some who claim that this work is shallow and without dimension, but to the adept minstrel, it is a description of form unparalleled by other works. Unfortunately, the book and its strident forms became 'unfashionable' after the fall of the North Kingdom, as a deep lethargy and cynicism crept over the kingdoms of Men, and the Elves withdrew ever further into their forest strongholds.

'Nowadays, The Rising Chord is quite difficult to find, and even when a copy is found -- such as this -- it is incomplete at best. Perhaps the famed Elvish minstrel Lindir might be able to tell you more about it.
deed.objectives: Collect The Rising Chord Talk to Lindir at the Last Homely House in Rivendell Collect The Rising Chord, Page 3 Collect The Rising Chord, Page 4 Collect The Rising Chord, Page 11 Collect The Rising Chord, Page 14 Collect The Rising Chord, Page 16 Collect The Rising Chord, Page 23 Collect The Rising Chord, Page 27 Collect The Rising Chord, Page 28

deed.name: Valour's Marches
deed.description:
The first four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Angmar, Eregion, and Moria. The last four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Forochel, Moria, and the Misty Mountains.

Valour's Marches -- the very title of the book you hold stirs something within your breast as you look upon it. Though its cover crumbles with age, the binding remains strong, as if infused with the same martial fervour that the melodies within it strive to invoke. This book is one of the rare few that survived the fall of the kingdom of Númenor, coming across the waves by some unlikely circumstance to Middle-earth, where it has lain hidden for ages. Though written in the Sindarin tongue, the songs are those of the noble kingdoms of Men. Nevertheless, they speak to the heart of any who would face battle, calling forth visions of endless, shining hosts on the march, thundering with the clash of steel in a thousand voices.

In the hands of a minstrel, these songs of martial eminence provide crucial insight into the working of the warrior's heart and how it might be aroused from its slumber in times of need. If only so many of the songs were not frustratingly missing from the volume you now hold. Perhaps Lindir of Rivendell may be able to help fill the voids.
deed.objectives: Collect Valour's Marches Talk to Lindir at the Last Homely House in Rivendell Collect Valour's Marches, Page 1 Collect Valour's Marches, Page 5 Collect Valour's Marches, Page 7 Collect Valour's Marches, Page 8 Collect Valour's Marches, Page 12 Collect Valour's Marches, Page 16 Collect Valour's Marches, Page 23 Collect Valour's Marches, Page 26

deed.name: The Book of Knives
deed.description:
The first four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Angmar, Eregion, and Moria. The last four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Forochel, Moria, and the Misty Mountains.

The Book of Knives was written by a burglar of great renown -- she is even said to have retrieved the choicest gem of a hoard from beneath the grasping claw of a sleeping dragon -- but her true name remains unknown and many doubt the veracity of her most outlandish exploits. Nevertheless, she was acknowledged as one of the finest knife-fighters in Middle-earth during her time.

Sadly, The Book of Knives is incomplete; little can be gleaned from its cryptic writings. The famous burglar Bilbo Baggins is known for his love of riddles and mysteries -- perhaps he might be able to shed some light on this text.
deed.objectives: Collect The Book of Knives Talk to Bilbo Baggins at the Last Homely House in Rivendell. Collect The Book of Knives, Page 3 Collect The Book of Knives, Page 5 Collect The Book of Knives, Page 12 Collect The Book of Knives, Page 17 Collect The Book of Knives, Page 18 Collect The Book of Knives, Page 23 Collect The Book of Knives, Page 26 Collect The Book of Knives, Page 31

deed.name: Knee-breaker's Manual
deed.description:
The first four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Angmar, Eregion, and Moria. The last four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Forochel, Moria, and the Misty Mountains.

Knee-breaker's Manual is an odd tome -- it appears to be written in a rather careful and precise script, but the passages themselves describe a particularly coarse and savage individual. Whoever he was, the exploits described in this book certainly lean to the unsavoury side of the burglar's profession. Nevertheless, there are a number of intriguing points that the author of the book presents.

Frustratingly, several key pages are missing. It is said that the famous burglar Bilbo Baggins has undertaken a study of the profession since his retirement -- perhaps he could tell you something about this 'Knee-breaker' or the missing sections of his manual?
deed.objectives: Collect Knee-breaker's Manual Talk to Bilbo Baggins at the Last Homely House in Rivendell. Collect Knee-breaker's Manual, Page 1 Collect Knee-breaker's Manual, Page 3 Collect Knee-breaker's Manual, Page 4 Collect Knee-breaker's Manual, Page 8 Collect Knee-breaker's Manual, Page 10 Collect Knee-breaker's Manual, Page 15 Collect Knee-breaker's Manual, Page 16 Collect Knee-breaker's Manual, Page 19

deed.name: The Expert's Guide to Dirty Fighting
deed.description:
The first four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Angmar, Eregion, and Moria. The last four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Forochel, Moria, and the Misty Mountains.

The Expert's Guide to Dirty Fighting was written about a rather notorious hobbit-burglar mid Third Age, when the Shire was not so secure as it is today. Having found himself drafted into the Shire-muster during a particularly difficult season and pitted against Golfimbul's goblins in a number of pitched battles, he learned to fight in a most ungentlehobbitly fashion that served him well against foes considerably larger and stronger than himself.

Alas, it has been many years since its writing, and all copies of this interesting text were thought lost, until now. Perhaps the famous hobbit-burglar Bilbo Baggins will have some further insights or thoughts on the book.
deed.objectives: Collect The Expert's Guide to Dirty Fighting Talk to Bilbo Baggins at the Last Homely House in Rivendell. Collect The Expert's Guide to Dirty Fighting, Page 4 Collect The Expert's Guide to Dirty Fighting, Page 5 Collect The Expert's Guide to Dirty Fighting, Page 7 Collect The Expert's Guide to Dirty Fighting, Page 12 Collect The Expert's Guide to Dirty Fighting, Page 15 Collect The Expert's Guide to Dirty Fighting, Page 19 Collect The Expert's Guide to Dirty Fighting, Page 24 Collect The Expert's Guide to Dirty Fighting, Page 28

deed.name: The Life of a Bounder (final)
deed.description: Meet the needs of a very large number of Shire-folk.

deed.name: The Life of a Bounder (advanced)
deed.description: Continue meeting the needs of the Shire-folk

deed.name: The Life of a Bounder
deed.description: Satisfy the needs of the Shire-folk

deed.name: Cunning Wound
deed.description: Burglars cannot rely on strength and power to defeat their enemies -- but a severely bleeding wound will often do the trick.

deed.name: Swift and Subtle
deed.description: With extensive practice, your Subtle Stab will improve in deadliness.

deed.name: Perplexing Riddle
deed.description: A clever burglar can confuse opponents with odd challenges and riddles.

deed.name: Hidden Dagger
deed.description: It is always surprising how many enemies forget to look over their shoulder during a fight.

deed.name: Focused Eye
deed.description: Without the advantage of strength, you must rely on speed and agility. If you are fast enough, you might be able to finish a conflict with a single strike.

deed.name: Side-step
deed.description: When Orcs are raining arrows down upon you, you had best have a spring in your step.

deed.name: Trickster
deed.description: So what if it is an old trick? The old tricks are the best tricks.

deed.name: Strike from Shadows
deed.description: You have only one shot when ambushing an opponent -- make it count!
deed.objectives: Land Critical blows with skills that benefit from stealth (400)

deed.name: Footpad
deed.description: If you cannot be seen, you cannot be killed. So do not be seen.

deed.name: Disabling Attack
deed.description: Certain postures will force enemies to fight with greater caution, limiting their ability to attack.

deed.name: Opportunist
deed.description: Every creature has its weak spots -- eyes, throat, spleen, something -- you just need to figure out what they are.

deed.name: Overwhelming Odds
deed.description: Burglars are notoriously fond of maneuvering their enemies into deadly situations where their allies can quickly defeat them.

deed.name: Leaf-walker
deed.description: Moving silently is easy - moving silently and quickly? That is a challenge....

deed.name: Blind Fury
deed.description: You must master the art of angering someone so much that they forgo their weapons in an attempt to throttle you with their bare hands.

deed.name: Alert Guard
deed.description: The more practiced you are with your Defensive Strike, the more protection it will afford you.

deed.name: Turn of the Tide
deed.description: No warrior, be they of light or darkness, can suffer to watch a fellow fall in battle without becoming unsettled. A clever captain can sow the seeds of doubt and fear in the hearts of those who remain.

deed.name: Renewed Voice
deed.description: A trumpet-call and cry of triumph oft begin the rage of war.

deed.name: Echoing Shout
deed.description: Warriors can have little faith in a leader who is unable to intimidate the enemy.

deed.name: Captain's Valour
deed.description: Leaders who would inspire their troops to acts of great valour must lead from the front, where their example can be seen by all those who follow them.

deed.name: Fear no Darkness
deed.description: Warriors must have courage to do battle, and in battle it is your sworn duty to ensure they have it.

deed.name: Strong Voice
deed.description: All the florid phrases and knowledge of the hearts of warriors will avail you not if you lack the strength to even draw a breath.

deed.name: Captain's Hope
deed.description: In times of war, soldiers must rally to symbols of hope and valour if they are to prove victorious when badly outnumbered.

deed.name: Expert Attacks
deed.description: A great captain must lead by example. Prove your skill in battle!
deed.objectives: Land critical hits with Devastating Blow (100)

deed.name: Intimidating Shout
deed.description: A skilled captain can often bluff an enemy into facing them, thus saving a hard-pressed companion.

deed.name: Improved Routing Cry
deed.description: Fortunately, being the centre of attention in a battle can help lead your allies through safely.

deed.name: Captain's Victory
deed.description: Captains carry forth banners to inspire and rally their troops. Each carries their own meaning and history and those who follow them strive to honour those tales.

deed.name: Blood of Númenor
deed.description: When a warrior falls in battle, it is not enough to simply ease their pain if the battle is to be won -- they must be made ready for battle again as quickly as possible.
deed.objectives: Save allies from the brink of death (100)

deed.name: Now for Wrath
deed.description: All the stalwart bravery in the world will not save a warrior who no longer has the strength to lift their sword.

deed.name: Flurry of Blows
deed.description: A quick hand can oft mean the difference between victory and defeat.

deed.name: Swift to Anger
deed.description: Swift strike is a dangerous attack, but it normally leaves you a bit off balance, unless you can truly master it.

deed.name: Deadly Strikes
deed.description: Champions are known for their reckless and powerful strikes in battle, cleaving any foolish enough to stand in their way.

deed.name: Winds of the Storm
deed.description: Blade-storm is one of the Champion's most impressive attacks, causing considerable havoc upon the field of battle.

deed.name: Braced against Defeat
deed.description: The Bracing Attack is an important tool used by Champions who must fight alone and outnumbered.

deed.name: Blood-lust
deed.description: Food, drink, companionship -- for the Champion, all of these are second to the joys of battle...drink is a very close second though.
deed.objectives: Land Critical Hits using Wild Attack (50)

deed.name: Call of the Wild
deed.description: Champions prefer to fight their enemies face-to-face, so that they may look their foes in the eye as they fall.

deed.name: Flashing Blade
deed.description: The Blade-wall is a staple of battle for champions, allowing them to engage multiple opponents in battle and evening the odds when outnumbered.

deed.name: Deep Strikes
deed.description: Deep wounds are deadly wounds. Many a warrior survives the battle, but not the night that follows.

deed.name: At the Ready
deed.description: Champions are students of battle and become adept at controlling the ebb and flow of each conflict.
deed.objectives: Use Ebbing Ire or Rising Ire (100)

deed.name: Eye of the Storm
deed.description: The Blade-storm is considered one of the most exacting and difficult maneuvers a Champion can execute, it is worth learning it well.

deed.name: Fervent Rage
deed.description: Sometimes you do not have time to work yourself up to a task; you must simply hurl yourself into the breach.

deed.name: Time of Need
deed.description: Some champions have been known to hurl themselves into battle with such vigour that they injure themselves more grievously than the enemy does.

deed.name: Patience
deed.description: When trapped in a furious melee, even a Champion may find themselves overwhelmed if they fail to take the measure of their opponents and flail about wildly.

deed.name: Stinging Blow
deed.description: Sometimes the most basic styles avail the greatest results.
deed.objectives: Strike enemies with the Sting skill (750)

deed.name: Reactive Block
deed.description: A shield is not simply some hobbit's door that has been strapped to your arm. It is as effective a weapon as any, and better than most for one who has mastered it.

deed.name: Guardian's Ward
deed.description: Constant vigilance is needed to protect oneself in battle. A moment's forgetfulness can be the end of you.

deed.name: Shield Expertise
deed.description: To truly measure the worth of a shield, one must master it as a living thing with a motion and cunning equal to that of any sword or bow.

deed.name: Controlled Breathing
deed.description: There is no point in going into a fight if you always run out of breath just as things are getting good.

deed.name: Harasser
deed.description: A Guardian is talented at drawing the attention of his enemies away from his friends.

deed.name: To the Rescue
deed.description: Above all, a Guardian must be where they are needed and quickly, for your companions are not so sturdy as you.

deed.name: Quickness
deed.description: Time is of the essence in battle. It can either be your ally or your enemy. It is best to have it on your side, because you are not going to beat it in the end.
deed.objectives: Strike enemies with the Sting skill (1500)

deed.name: Grim Challenge
deed.description: A Guardian's task is to protect his allies from the assaults of their foes.

deed.name: Selfless Defence
deed.description: A Guardian's most important role is to ensure the lives of their companions. A Guardian who forgets this creed is no Guardian at all, but a preening fool.

deed.name: Stoic
deed.description: Many would call Guardians fatalistic. Perhaps they should try holding a bridge alone against countless Orcs?

deed.name: Strong Lungs
deed.description: When preparing for intense exertion, it is advisable to take a deep breath before diving into the fray.

deed.name: Brave Heart
deed.description: Every warrior tests his limits and faces his own mortality in battle.

deed.name: Heat of Battle
deed.description: Many claim that the Champion knows the greatest joy in battle. Those who believe this have never seen a Guardian wading into a throng of foes, sinews singing to the thrill of mortal peril.
deed.objectives: Use Thrill of Danger in battle (125)

deed.name: Sturdy Traps
deed.description: Traps are not by their nature terribly dependable weapons. They are nevertheless effective.
deed.objectives: Use your Set Trap or Set Snare skills (350)

deed.name: Rapid Recovery
deed.description: It is all very nice to strike down enemies at range. As battle goes it is a quiet, serene art, but that is not always an option, and when things get close, they get messy.

deed.name: Barbed Fury
deed.description: Hunters who mean business often use cruelly barbed or bladed arrows during battle.

deed.name: Swift and True
deed.description: It is said that the Elves developed the art of the Swift Bow long ago, but the old tales do not say who among them first mastered it.

deed.name: Strong Draw
deed.description: The strength required to pull a bowstring back with sufficient power to penetrate armour is sorely underestimated by warriors who do not understand the art of the Hunter.

deed.name: Heightened Senses
deed.description: Hunters are often renowned for their ability to see what is hidden and follow signs that few others are even aware of.

deed.name: Hail of Arrows
deed.description: When facing large numbers of enemies the role of the Hunter goes from that of deadly artist to a bringer of terror from the skies.
deed.objectives: Strike enemies with Rain of Arrows (500)

deed.name: Arrow-storm
deed.description: When a Hunter faces many foes, the only answer is a great many arrows.
deed.objectives: Earn the Hail of Arrows trait (1) Strike enemies with Rain of Arrows (600)

deed.name: Deep Concentration
deed.description: The Hunter depends on precision and focus above all other things, but few realize the endurance it takes to pull back that arrow as well, and fatigue quickly clouds one's vision.

deed.name: Deadly Precision
deed.description: Hunters cannot rely on brute force to achieve victory in battle, so it is important to find your enemy's weaknesses.
deed.objectives: Land critical hits with your Bow Skills (500)

deed.name: True Shot
deed.description: Few of your foes are foolish enough to take to the field of battle without armour, but every armour has its flaws.

deed.name: Springloaded Traps
deed.description: Some traps will strip off the natural armour of their targets increasing the damage taken from other sources.
deed.objectives: Use your Set Trap or Set Snare skills (350)

deed.name: Stealthy Shot
deed.description: Many fear Hunters not for the death they bring, but for the silence with which it approaches.

deed.name: Swift Recovery
deed.description: Sometimes it is best to sacrifice precision and power for a great deal of speed.

deed.name: Master of the Staff
deed.description: Even a lore-master will occasionally find himself face-to-face with the enemy. At times like these, a sturdy oaken staff may take on a simpler and most vital role.

deed.name: Power and Wisdom
deed.description: There is much to be learned from your enemies, but every Lore-master must decide for themselves how deeply to delve into the darkness. Every being has their limits, and it is never clear when you have taken a step too far until it is too late to return.

deed.name: Light of Hope
deed.description: Hope is so much more than a naive emotion or dream...it is a wellspring of great power.

deed.name: Master of Beasts
deed.description: Of the magicks that can be wielded by Man or Elf, the hearts of beasts are among the most closely tied to the visible world, and so there are many who strive to master them.
deed.objectives: Use Sign of the Wild: Protection (500)

deed.name: Deep Lore
deed.description: The elements of nature can be truly understood by few and to those few alone will they lend their power.
deed.objectives: Use your Lore Skills against enemies (500)

deed.name: Healer
deed.description: Among the most respected forms of learning is that of healing. Every Lore-master should strive to understand this fundamental art.
deed.objectives: Heal your fellows with Knowledge of Cures (250)

deed.name: Beast-lore
deed.description: The Lore-master is friend to beast and bird and may call upon their aid.
deed.objectives: Use Sign of the Wild: Rage (300)

deed.name: Dúnadan-learning
deed.description: While the Elves were long known as masters of lore, the Dúnedain of old were very near their equals in many arts.
deed.objectives: Use Signs of Power or Battle (1000)

deed.name: Harmony with Nature
deed.description: Lore-masters are often said to be in harmony with the forces of nature. It is sometimes difficult to understand what is so harmonious about the earth-rents they just ripped open under an enemy's feet however.

deed.name: Awareness of Body
deed.description: Clearly, if one is to learn to properly manipulate the forces of nature and other lore, one must first understand the true nature of power.

deed.name: Subtlety of Wisdom
deed.description: Many Lore-masters choose to forsake the garish magics of thunderous fire and glamour, for they may bring the wrath of the Enemy quickly upon them.
deed.objectives: Use Blinding Flash against your enemies (400)

deed.name: Proof against all Ills
deed.description: Disease and illness has always been a favoured weapon of the Enemy, and Lore-masters have long striven to contest this power to greater or lesser success.

deed.name: Knowledge of the Past
deed.description: Much of what simpler folk call magic is tied to the life of the world and is intertwined with it since the time before days.

deed.name: Magic Adept
deed.description: Lore-masters are dreaded for their ability to ignite any object in their hands.
deed.objectives: Use Burning Embers or Sticky Gourd, or either of the Improved versions of these skills (500)

deed.name: Harmonious Melody
deed.description: The magic of the voice is a delicate thing, easily disturbed by failures of harmony or rhythm.

deed.name: Herald's Hammer
deed.description: In this time of strife, even a minstrel cannot travel the roads unarmed.

deed.name: Smooth Voice
deed.description: The Piercing Cry is rough on the throat, making it difficult to utter too often without losing one's voice.

deed.name: Powerful Voice
deed.description: Minstrels often find it difficult to make themselves heard over the din of battle.

deed.name: Life-singer
deed.description: The songs of life are quite draining, and only the most experienced minstrels can use them for long.
deed.objectives: Use your Healing and Motivation Skills (1000)

deed.name: Unrelenting
deed.description: It is said that minstrels who can maintain the most difficult keys can cause disorienting pain to their foes.
deed.objectives: Land Critical hits with Piercing Cry (100)

deed.name: Focused Performance
deed.description: You find it considerably more difficult to maintain proper pitch when some goblin is attempting to tickle your ribs with a short sword.

deed.name: Light in the Dark
deed.description: Many creatures of evil and darkness do not fare well before the beauty and light of music.

deed.name: Graceful Demeanour
deed.description: For those who have lost all hope during battle, perhaps new hope can be kindled in between the notes of a song...
deed.objectives: Use Enlivening Grace or Improved Enlivening Grace (100)

deed.name: Silver Tongue
deed.description: Lately you have been hearing a faint strain of music, seemingly more beautiful even than that of the Elves. But where could it be coming from?

deed.name: Subtle Movements
deed.description: Unfortunately, the old tales are filled with incidents of foolhardy minstrels finding themselves riddled with arrows as they bravely sing their last upon the field of battle.

deed.name: Strength of Voice
deed.description: The most powerful music is also the most tiring, and it cannot be sustained for long.

deed.name: Battle-hymn
deed.description: The Cry of the Valar is considered one of the most stirring pieces of music ever sung upon the battlefield.

deed.name: Heralded Saviour
deed.description: It is believed that by lightening the heart with song, one can more easily weather the physical ills of the world.

deed.name: A Shot in the Dark
deed.description:
The first four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Angmar, Eregion, and Moria. The last four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Forochel, Moria, and the Misty Mountains.

This journal was written by a hunter who seems to have spent much of his time alone somewhere on the western borders of Mirkwood across the Misty Mountains, where few Men live and goblins present a frequent threat. With no allies to rely upon and always outnumbered, he discovered the value of uncertainty and fear as a weapon to keep his pursuers off balance as he strove to survive in that rugged country. Having no-one to talk to, it seems that he chose to create a record of his life and experiences.

This journal is badly weathered and torn -- perhaps by the self-same goblins whom the hunter claims to have frequently out-witted -- and several key passages are missing. Another hunter of renown might be able to shed some light on this unusual book. Legolas of Mirkwood is said to be in Eriador on a mission of some import.
deed.objectives: Collect A Shot in the Dark Talk to Legolas in Rivendell Collect A Shot in the Dark, Page 5 Collect A Shot in the Dark, Page 10 Collect A Shot in the Dark, Page 14 Collect A Shot in the Dark, Page 16 Collect A Shot in the Dark, Page 19 Collect A Shot in the Dark, Page 22 Collect A Shot in the Dark, Page 23 Collect A Shot in the Dark, Page 25

deed.name: The Way of the Hunter
deed.description:
The first four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Angmar, Eregion, and Moria. The last four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Forochel, Moria, and the Misty Mountains.

You have heard of this book before -- The Way of the Hunter is believed to have been a work produced by Elven hunters who were set to the task of guarding the approaches of the hidden city of Gondolin, which fell to the forces of darkness in the First Age. While this work outlived its authors and has been copied innumerable times since, many of those copies were produced by Men from far older works and are imperfect in their translation, leaving several important points untold.

This copy of The Way of the Hunter appears to have been a much more accurate work, probably transcribed by Elven scribes in Rivendell or Lórien -- but unfortunately someone seems to have intentionally defaced the book, ripping several pages from it. Legolas of the Elves might be able to shed some light on the text.
deed.objectives: Collect The Way of the Hunter Talk to Legolas in Rivendell Collect The Way of the Hunter, Page 1 Collect The Way of the Hunter, Page 3 Collect The Way of the Hunter, Page 4 Collect The Way of the Hunter, Page 8 Collect The Way of the Hunter, Page 17 Collect The Way of the Hunter, Page 20 Collect The Way of the Hunter, Page 21 Collect The Way of the Hunter, Page 28

deed.name: The Furthest Charge
deed.description:
The first four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Angmar, Eregion, and Moria. The last four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Forochel, Moria, and the Misty Mountains.

The Furthest Charge was written by a Captain of Gondor who fought in a misguided battle shortly before the War of the Last Alliance. In this battle, the forces of the young kingdom of Gondor found themselves pitted against a company of Elven hunters out of Lórien, both sides having been tricked into battle by a device of the Enemy, who was determined to cripple the alliance that would eventually result in his overthrow. In this book, the Captain describes a valiant but doomed charge of the Men of Gondor against the Elves, within which they suffered a terrible onslaught of arrows raining down from the sky in such fashion as to cause brave men to cower and falter in their advance, trapped unmoving beneath an endless hail of biting wood and metal.

The Furthest Charge is considered to be a defining work on the power of the hunter's art in the grand battles that have defined the face of Middle-earth today. Unfortunately, this copy is badly damaged by time and wear. Perhaps Legolas of Mirkwood, purported to be in Eriador, could shed some light upon the text.
deed.objectives: Collect The Furthest Charge Talk to Legolas in Rivendell Collect The Furthest Charge, Page 7 Collect The Furthest Charge, Page 9 Collect The Furthest Charge, Page 10 Collect The Furthest Charge, Page 14 Collect The Furthest Charge, Page 17 Collect The Furthest Charge, Page 18 Collect The Furthest Charge, Page 21 Collect The Furthest Charge, Page 24

deed.name: The Candle's Flame
deed.description:
The first four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Angmar, Eregion, and Moria. The last four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Forochel, Moria, and the Misty Mountains.

The Candle's Flame is a stirring piece written by one of the great Captains of Gondor during the War of the Last Alliance. It speaks of the very personal connexion that a worthy captain forms with his followers, and the power that bond can have when a fallen warrior lies upon the threshold of Death's door. Few copies of this book exist today, most having been lost in the long years since or secreted away in the hidden libraries of the Lords of Gondor.

This copy of The Candle's Flame is missing many important pages. Rumour tells that Boromir, a Captain of Gondor, has come north. Perhaps he can help you comprehend the broken knowledge of this book.
deed.objectives: Collect The Candle's Flame Talk to Boromir in Rivendell Collect The Candle's Flame, Page 4 Collect The Candle's Flame, Page 7 Collect The Candle's Flame, Page 13 Collect The Candle's Flame, Page 16 Collect The Candle's Flame, Page 25 Collect The Candle's Flame, Page 26 Collect The Candle's Flame, Page 31 Collect The Candle's Flame, Page 35

deed.name: The Treatise of Valour
deed.description:
The first four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Angmar, Eregion, and Moria. The last four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Forochel, Moria, and the Misty Mountains.

The Treatise of Valour was written by a council of captains who once commanded the great fortresses of the ancient kingdom of Arnor during the height of its power. It was said to have been the foundation stone of the principles of leadership and warfare for the warriors of Arnor and offered knowledge and teaching that proved key to staving off the assaults of Angmar for so long as the North Kingdom stood. All the remaining copies of the Treatise were believed lost or burned in the Sack of Fornost.

Many pages of this book, The Treatise of Valour, have been torn or burned, rendering the volume nearly unreadable. Perhaps Boromir of Gondor, recently come north, will know something about it.
deed.objectives: Collect Treatise of Valour Talk to Boromir in Rivendell Collect Treatise of Valour, Page 2 Collect Treatise of Valour, Page 3 Collect Treatise of Valour, Page 5 Collect Treatise of Valour, Page 10 Collect Treatise of Valour, Page 12 Collect Treatise of Valour, Page 15 Collect Treatise of Valour, Page 18 Collect Treatise of Valour, Page 22

deed.name: The Book of Oaths
deed.description:
The first four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Angmar, Eregion, and Moria. The last four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Forochel, Moria, and the Misty Mountains.

The Book of Oaths discusses the central role of Honour in true leadership and the sanctity of a King's Oath -- or a Captain's. Much of the power to guide men truly derives from the simple bond of Truth itself, and for those who lead, an Oath is a bond of commitment that cannot be broken without inviting a fate most dire. Indeed, a captain who would betray his own word risks more than his life, for it is well-known that an Oath fatefully taken binds far more than the flesh.

This book is said to be the utmost authority in such matters, but the copy you have found seems badly damaged and many important passages are missing. Perhaps Boromir of Gondor, who currently rides here in the north, may know something about this book.
deed.objectives: Collect The Book of Oaths Talk to Boromir in Rivendell Collect The Book of Oaths, Page 6 Collect The Book of Oaths, Page 8 Collect The Book of Oaths, Page 9 Collect The Book of Oaths, Page 14 Collect The Book of Oaths, Page 17 Collect The Book of Oaths, Page 19 Collect The Book of Oaths, Page 23 Collect The Book of Oaths, Page 28

deed.name: The Tome of Swords
deed.description:
The first four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Angmar, Eregion, and Moria. The last four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Forochel, Moria, and the Misty Mountains.

Written in a neatly defined Sindarin script, The Tome of Swords has long been renowned as one of the finest manuals on the art of swordsmanship and battle. Originally written in the early ages of Middle-earth, many copies exist -- but sometime shortly after the end of the Second Age, most of them either vanished or had important passages edited, meaning that most of the copies that exist today are incomplete.

The copy you have found appears to be mostly intact, but time and wear have done the duty of whomever wished to limit the knowledge contained therein. There are a few pages that are either missing or too badly weathered to read. Perhaps the dwarf Gimli, son of Glóin of the Lonely Mountain, could tell you more about this ancient tome.
deed.objectives: Collect The Tome of Swords Talk to Gimli in Rivendell Collect The Tome of Swords, Page 1 Collect The Tome of Swords, Page 4 Collect The Tome of Swords, Page 7 Collect The Tome of Swords, Page 12 Collect The Tome of Swords, Page 13 Collect The Tome of Swords, Page 17 Collect The Tome of Swords, Page 21 Collect The Tome of Swords, Page 25

deed.name: The Joy of Battle
deed.description:
The first four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Angmar, Eregion, and Moria. The last four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Forochel, Moria, and the Misty Mountains.

The Joy of Battle is an aptly named text, written by a great dwarf-champion during the height of Durin's reign in Khazad-dûm. It is no simple treatise on the art of battle, as so many texts are. Rather, it is a philosophical tract that describes the author's outlook upon warfare and battle, and how he came eventually to seek it out as a meditative and even transcendant experience that he was unable to experience in any other setting save the midst of clashing blades and the cries of battle. It is not a text for the faint-hearted or the meek, but it seems oddly lofty and its tone does not reflect the maddened bloodlust that one might have expected given the title.

Alas, the long years have been rough on your copy, and there are a number of pages torn or missing from it. Gimli the Dwarf might have some insight into the missing knowledge of The Joy of Battle, since it was written by one of his forebears in the depths of time.
deed.objectives: Collect The Joy of Battle Talk to Gimli in Rivendell Collect The Joy of Battle, Page 11 Collect The Joy of Battle, Page 14 Collect The Joy of Battle, Page 18 Collect The Joy of Battle, Page 24 Collect The Joy of Battle, Page 25 Collect The Joy of Battle, Page 28 Collect The Joy of Battle, Page 32 Collect The Joy of Battle, Page 36

deed.name: The Artisan Blade
deed.description:
The first four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Angmar, Eregion, and Moria. The last four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Forochel, Moria, and the Misty Mountains.

Given the title, you half expected that this book would have been written by an Elf -- and indeed the script is Sindarin -- but it seems that the author is a champion of some ancient Númenórean lineage from a time before the founding of Arnor. The text is so ancient that some of the pages threaten to crumble in your hands as you carefully peruse it. While the dialect is ancient and difficult to read, the author's approach to swordsmanship is rather unusual, placing a great deal of emphasis on grueling repetition and concentration around what appear to be the most basic motions of the form. It suggests a focus on absolute control and power, which then leads to the discovery of finesse and artistry.

If only several key passages and pages were not missing, it could be an invaluable training guide -- perhaps Gimli the Dwarf could tell you more?
deed.objectives: Collect The Artisan Blade Talk to Gimli in Rivendell Collect The Artisan Blade, Page 2 Collect The Artisan Blade, Page 4 Collect The Artisan Blade, Page 6 Collect The Artisan Blade, Page 9 Collect The Artisan Blade, Page 14 Collect The Artisan Blade, Page 15 Collect The Artisan Blade, Page 17 Collect The Artisan Blade, Page 26

deed.name: The Best Defence
deed.description:
The first four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Angmar, Eregion, and Moria. The last four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Forochel, Moria, and the Misty Mountains.

This book was written as a primer in the Guardian's art some time in the middle of the Third Age, during the difficult period after the fall of Khazad-dûm. At that time, Durin's Folk were scattered and greatly reduced in number, and the Guardian's role took on a much greater importance as the threat of goblins and Orcs to dwarf-settlements beneath the roots of the world became more and more common. The dwarves often settled for building powerful strongholds designed to make the approach to their cities, impervious to assault, manning them with skilled and powerful guardians to ensure that none would pass unchallenged.

While the book itself is common enough, the owner of this copy seems to have scribbled copious notes within the margins of the pages -- notes containing an experience and insight to the art that even at a glance exceeds that of the original author. Unfortunately, the copy is worn and tattered, and a number of pages are missing. Perhaps someone well-versed in the art could provide you with some insight as to the identity of the mysterious scribbler and where his remaining notes could be found?
deed.objectives: Collect The Best Defence Talk to Samwise Gamgee in Rivendell Collect The Best Defence, Page 2 Collect The Best Defence, Page 3 Collect The Best Defence, Page 5 Collect The Best Defence, Page 9 Collect The Best Defence, Page 12 Collect The Best Defence, Page 16 Collect The Best Defence, Page 17 Collect The Best Defence, Page 19

deed.name: A Shield-maiden's Song
deed.description:
The first four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Angmar, Eregion, and Moria. The last four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Forochel, Moria, and the Misty Mountains.

A Shield-maiden's Song was written many long years ago and tells the tale of a Shield-maiden of Rohan. While the Shield-maidens of Rohan were rarely called to war, they were nevertheless as well-trained and versed in the arts of battle as their male counterparts. This book tells the tale of one such Maiden caught in unexpected battle, who in striving to defend her Lord against a great onslaught, sang out in clearest tones a stirring song of war as she fought. Such was the power of her voice that even the Orcs whom she faced saw her not as a frail woman, but as a great warrior to be feared.

Alas, you have no idea how the story ends and several other details beside seem to be missing from this copy of the book, which has been damaged by time and neglect. Perhaps there is someone at Rivendell who would be able to make use of it.
deed.objectives: Collect A Shield-maiden's Song Talk to Samwise Gamgee in Rivendell Collect A Shield-maiden's Song, Page 1 Collect A Shield-maiden's Song, Page 8 Collect A Shield-maiden's Song, Page 11 Collect A Shield-maiden's Song, Page 12 Collect A Shield-maiden's Song, Page 15 Collect A Shield-maiden's Song, Page 19 Collect A Shield-maiden's Song, Page 25 Collect A Shield-maiden's Song, Page 26

deed.name: The Final Word
deed.description:
The first four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Angmar, Eregion, and Moria. The last four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Forochel, Moria, and the Misty Mountains.

This book is of Elvish origin, having been written so long ago that few of the Elves today were alive at the time of its writing. You cannot even guess at how old it actually is, as it seems to show few signs of age or decay. You cannot recognize the type of parchment it was written upon, nor what kind of ink could withstand the passage of so much time without fading. The main indication of its age and origin is the writing style which is in an extremely old form using ancient letters called Tengwar, which were created by the Noldor many ages ago. The main focus of the book is difficult to translate, but seems to centre around an ancient oath of battle that Elf-guardians might make in the midst of a desperate melee, in essence binding themselves and their enemies in a pact of battle and death that neither the oath-taker nor their sworn-enemies dared break.

It is clear from the text that these oaths carried power beyond that of any simple cry to infuriate or trick one's enemies -- but the secret of the technique seems lost as several key pages have been carefully cut from the book, presumably by someone hoping to safeguard its secrets in an age long past. Perhaps someone in Rivendell will be able to help decipher the book.
deed.objectives: Collect The Final Word Talk to Samwise Gamgee in Rivendell Collect The Final Word, Page 6 Collect The Final Word, Page 7 Collect The Final Word, Page 13 Collect The Final Word, Page 14 Collect The Final Word, Page 19 Collect The Final Word, Page 21 Collect The Final Word, Page 24 Collect The Final Word, Page 27

deed.name: Alluring
deed.description: There are those individuals with mysterious qualities that others find quite alluring.

deed.name: Befuddling
deed.description:
Some people just seem to talk in riddles all the time.

Whether they mean to do so or not varies...

deed.name: Beloved
deed.description: Many are those who seek true love -- few are those who find it.

deed.name: Harassed
deed.description: The world is filled with those who are less well off than ourselves.

deed.name: Ridiculed
deed.description: If you cannot say anything nice, do not say anything at all. Alas, some people never learned that lesson.

deed.name: Dull
deed.description: There are those with the mysterious ability to bring any conversation to a grinding halt.

deed.name: Fire-breather
deed.description: Some folk just enjoy the adulation of an audience.

deed.name: Helpful
deed.description: Some people just like to help out.

deed.name: Hero
deed.description: Some people demand respect -- while others work to earn it.

deed.name: Infuriating
deed.description: Some people are merely annoying, while others really know how to get under your skin.

deed.name: Insulted
deed.description: Sticks and stones may break my bones, but words will never hurt me...that is unless they are part of some spell -- those can sting.

deed.name: Intimidating
deed.description: While great size and strength can be intimidating, attitude can also take you a long way.

deed.name: Juggler
deed.description: The ability to amuse your friends is a skill worth cultivating.

deed.name: Naughty
deed.description: Some folks just cannot seem to behave themselves.

deed.name: Sword Salute
deed.description: There are those whose military bearing connotes respect.

deed.name: Victorious
deed.description: There are those who are born to win and those who are not.

deed.name: Breakfast Expert
deed.description: Breakfast is the most important meal of the day -- and you believe in starting the day right.

deed.name: Carnivore
deed.description: Green, leafy vegetables hold no interest for you. Only fresh meat provides proper sustenance.

deed.name: Pie Maven
deed.description: There are those who consider themselves knowledgable in the ways of magic or warfare. You, on the other hand, know a great deal about pies.

deed.name: Vegetable Master
deed.description: The flesh of beasts is not to your liking. You show a marked preference for greener fare.

deed.name: The Wary
deed.description: Achieve 5th level without falling in battle!
deed.objectives: Achieve 5th level without falling in battle!

deed.name: The Undefeated
deed.description: Achieve 10th level without falling in battle!
deed.objectives: Achieve 10th level without falling in battle!

deed.name: The Indomitable
deed.description: Achieve 14th level without falling in battle!
deed.objectives: Achieve 14th level without falling in battle!

deed.name: The Unscathed
deed.description: Achieve 17th level without falling in battle!
deed.objectives: Achieve 17th level without falling in battle!

deed.name: The Undying
deed.description:
Achieve 20th level without falling in battle!

Be warned - this is your final step along the path of the Survivor.
deed.objectives: Achieve 20th level without falling in battle!

deed.name: The High Passes
deed.description: In order to cross the Misty Mountains, travellers have long had to traverse high and trecherous passes, often choked with snow, knife-like winds, and other more aggressive hazards. Seek out these passes and learn the secret ways of the mountains.

deed.name: Ruins of the Misty Mountains
deed.description: There are not many ruins to be found in the Misty Mountains, for few indeed are those willing to build anything of note in such an inhospitable environment. Those that are to be found here were built long ago by the dwarves.
deed.objectives: Glóin's Camp Hríthur's Haven Iskeld's Lookout The Bitter Stair

deed.name: Where Giants Dwell
deed.description: Travellers have long told tales of the mighty and capricious giants that inhabit the cold peaks of the Misty Mountains, you must seek out their places for yourself however, for there are few who have seen them left to tell you the way.
deed.objectives: The Lornstone Greybough End The Giant's Needle Iorbar Gabilazan

deed.name: The Road to Rivendell
deed.description: The lone winding road through the Trollshaws leads to the last bastion of civilization for a great many leagues. Travellers must take great care while exploring this road however, for it is not well-guarded from the dangers of the wild.
deed.objectives: The Last Bridge Barachen's Camp The Ford of Bruinen The Gates of Imladris

deed.name: Ruins of the Trollshaws
deed.description: These lands once were the eastern extent of the old kingdom of Rhudaur. They have lain in ruins for many long years now and most are inhabited only by wild beasts -- or horrid creatures that have crawled more recently out of the depths of Angmar.
deed.objectives: Trapdoor Lair Ost Thondol Minas Ciliant Ost Chall Amon Varadh Ost Brandras Barad Glamgil Ost Dúrgonn

deed.name: Scouting the Dourhands
deed.description: Search out the strongholds of the Dourhand brigands.
deed.objectives: Ringdale The Grimwater Spire of Kheledûl Kheledûl Docks

deed.name: Places of the Dwarves
deed.description: Explore the places and settlements held by the Dwarves of the Blue Mountains.
deed.objectives: Frerin's Court Thorin's Gates Silver Deep Mine Noglond Gondamon

deed.name: Elf-ruins Exploration
deed.description: Explore the old places left behind by the Elves as they abandoned Edhelion and moved further south to Duillond.
deed.objectives: Nen Hilith Tham Gelair Limael's Vinyard Dol Ringwest The Wardspire

deed.name: Rath Teraig Exploration
deed.description: Explore the dark valley of Rath Teraig.
deed.objectives: Northern Barricade Southern Barricade Tum Agor Amon Thanc Crookdell

deed.name: The Villages of the Earth-kin
deed.description: An odd people calling themselves the Earth-kin have been discovered in the eastern North Downs. Seek out their villages and learn more of them, and whether they be friend or foe.
deed.objectives: Rusfold Fashat Laug Kar Lak Lehmä-koti

deed.name: The Eastern Ruins
deed.description: Many ruins lie forgotten in lands east of the Baranduin. Explore them and determine if they have fallen into the hands of the Enemy.
deed.objectives: Ost Lagoros Ost Galumar Dol Nendír Merenost Ost Crithlanc

deed.name: Strongholds Exploration
deed.description: Spy out the Orc and goblin-strongholds in the North Downs
deed.objectives: Nan Wathren Western Pass Nan Wathren Eastern Pass Hîgropor Hîsuk Tûmat

deed.name: The Western Ruins
deed.description: Explore the ruins scattered in and around the Fields of Fornost
deed.objectives: Amon Raith Minas Vrûn Ost Nuaran Falconer's Tower Norbury Gates Glírost Tham Lorn

deed.name: Garth Agarwen Exploration
deed.description: Garth Agarwen lies in the north-east hills of the Lone-lands. Once a great fortress of the ancient kingdoms, rumours say that it has become a stronghold of corruption and evil.
deed.objectives: The Circle of Blood Nan Dhelu The Outer Gates Garth Agarwen Gate Ivar's Crypt Spring of the Red Maid

deed.name: The Grimfens
deed.description: The Grimfens are in the south-east extent of the Lone-lands. Travellers have avoided this place for as long as any can remember -- and for good reason.

deed.name: Defences of the Lone-lands
deed.description: The Lone-lands were once host to a string of forts and towers that guarded the roads against the incursions of Angmar and Rhudaur. Long ago, they fell into ruin with the defeat of the North Kingdom.
deed.objectives: Barad Iachiant Ost Laden The Lornspan Mithrenost Thandobel Ost Cyrn Naerost Amon Ros Ost Guruth

deed.name: Weathertop Exploration
deed.description: Weathertop is in the western half of the Lone-lands. Its proper name of old is Amon Sûl, and within it once lay one of the palantíri of the ancient kingdoms.

deed.name: The Farms of the Shire
deed.description: Farming represents the heart of the Shire, and farmsteads can be found throughout -- the largest of which surround the town of Michel Delving.
deed.objectives: Dora Brownlock's Farm Bamfurlong Old Odo's Leaf-farm South Fields Appledores Puddifoot's Fields

deed.name: The Sights of the Shire
deed.description: The pastoral peace of the Shire presents travellers with an excellent opportunity to explore its historical and cultural places.
deed.objectives: The Party Tree Methel-stage Stocktower The Quarry Bridgefields Wall The Great Willow

deed.name: The Barrow-downs
deed.description: The Barrow-downs are south-west of Bree-town. For many generations the Dúnedain of Cardolan buried their dead within the Downs, until the Great Plague destroyed the last vestiges of Cardolan, and spirits from Angmar claimed the barrows. Now only the most brave -- or most foolhardy -- dare venture therein.
deed.objectives: Northern Barrows The Dead Spire The Dead Man's Perch The Great Barrow Ost Gorthad

deed.name: The Old Forest
deed.description: The Old Forest lies on the border between the Shire and Bree-land. For years beyond memory it has been a forbidding place, which Men and hobbits alike have shunned. Hobbit-tales tell that the trees are aware and can move of their own accord.
deed.objectives: Bald Hill The Weaver's Den Tom Bombadil's House Goldberry's Spring Bonfire Glade

deed.name: The Ruins of Breeland
deed.description: The ruins of old Arnor are scattered all across Bree-land. They remain a constant reminder of the ancient glories of the North Kingdom...and of the evil that destroyed it.
deed.objectives: Bronwe's Folly Hillshire Ruins The Old Greenway Fort Blackwold's Roost Blackwold Headquarters Woodsedge Ruins Ost Baranor Marshwater Fort Goblinhole Ruins South-guard Ruins

deed.description: Old tales tell of eight entwives who passed from the south into the Old Forest, never to be seen again. Could they be true?

deed.description: Danger presses upon Bree-land from all sides, foreshadowing the ascension of a great darkness. You are called to stand against the Shadow. Your extraordinary efforts on behalf of Bree-land will be rewarded.

deed.name: Of Glories Long Past
deed.description: The North Downs were once the home to the capitol of the North Kingdom. Now it lies in ruin, inviting the return of Angmar.

deed.name: Of Glories Long Past (advanced)
deed.description: Orcs and evil Men out of Angmar have overrun the virtually empty North Downs, threatening the safety of the few farmers who remain there.

deed.name: Of Glories Long Past (Final)
deed.description: The Rangers of the North muster their forces within their hidden refuge of Esteldín, preparing to turn back the tide of the Iron Crown.

deed.name: Barghest-slayer
deed.description: The vile Barghests, bred down from wild hounds and twisted to evil by the Dark Lord Sauron, often range where the Dead roam. You are called to drive the Barghests from the Barrow-downs.

deed.name: Barghest-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: The vile Barghests, bred down from wild hounds and twisted to evil by the Dark Lord Sauron, often range where the Dead roam. You are called to drive the Barghests from the Barrow-downs.

deed.name: Brigand-slayer
deed.description: Many bands of brigands roam the wilds of Bree-land, waylaying travellers and bullying the inhabitants of Bree and the towns surrounding it. It is up to you to counter the threat the brigands pose to the inhabitants of Bree-land.

deed.name: Brigand-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Many bands of brigands roam the wilds of Bree-land, waylaying travellers and bullying the inhabitants of Bree and the towns surrounding it. It is up to you to counter the threat the brigands pose to the inhabitants of Bree-land.

deed.name: Bree-land Woodsman
deed.description: Legends of the Old Forest abound. It is a place of fear and malevolent spirit. Some dark will fills the trees with a hatred of all that goes on two legs. It is up to you to quell the Forest's malevolent spirit.
deed.objectives: Defeat awakened trees in the Old Forest (20)

deed.name: Bree-land Woodsman (Advanced)
deed.description: Legends of the Old Forest abound. It is a place of fear and malevolent spirit. Some dark will fills the trees with a hatred of all that goes on two legs. It is up to you to quell the Forest's malevolent spirit.
deed.objectives: Defeat awakened trees in the Old Forest (40)

deed.name: Neekerbreeker-slayer
deed.description: The Midgewater Marshes are home to the Neekerbreekers, a variety of annoying insect that has recently become hostile, following the passage of Black Riders from the East. You are called to halt the plague of Neekerbreekers.

deed.name: Neekerbreeker-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: The Midgewater Marshes are home to the Neekerbreekers, a variety of annoying insect that has recently become hostile, following the passage of Black Riders from the East. You are called to halt the plague of Neekerbreekers.

deed.name: Orc-slayer
deed.description: A company of Orcs has passed into Bree-land from the North Downs, ravaging the countryside and razing farms. The advance of the Orcs out of the North must be brought to a halt.

deed.name: Orc-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: A company of Orcs has passed into Bree-land from the North Downs, ravaging the countryside and razing farms. The advance of the Orcs out of the North must be brought to a halt.

deed.name: Sickle-fly Slayer
deed.description: With the passing of Black Riders from the East, the disease-bearing sickle-flies of the Midgewater Marshes have begun to breed more rapidly, threatening to spread contagion among the inhabitants of Bree-land. You are tasked with ending the threat of the sickle-flies' plague.

deed.name: Sickle-fly Slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: With the passing of Black Riders from the East, the disease-bearing sickle-flies of the Midgewater Marshes have begun to breed more rapidly, threatening to spread contagion among the inhabitants of Bree-land. You are tasked with ending the threat of the sickle-flies' plague.

deed.name: Spider-slayer
deed.description: Strange, monstrous spiders have crept into Bree-land from the dark corners of Mirkwood, beyond the Misty Mountains in the east. Your courage will be tested against the spider infestation spreading through the forests and marshes of Bree-land.

deed.name: Spider-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Strange, monstrous spiders have crept into Bree-land from the dark corners of Mirkwood, beyond the Misty Mountains in the east. Your courage will be tested against the spider infestation spreading through the forests and marshes of Bree-land.

deed.name: Wight-slayer
