deed.name: Conquest of Tol Ascarnen
deed.description: Defeat the enemy Chieftains controlling the fortress of Tol Ascarnen!

deed.name: Conquest of Dargazag
deed.description:
The Enemy's forces in the field are led by a number of Chieftans.

Defeating them all will weaken the morale of their forces, and deny them leadership.

deed.name: Conquest of the Towers
deed.description: Two strong towers oversee the defences of the Ettenmoors, defeat the enemy chieftains inhabiting these towers!

deed.name: Tyrants of the Enemy
deed.description: Find and defeat the Tyrants of the forces of the Enemy in the Ettenmoors, ensuring the victory of the armies of the West.

deed.name: Shire Brew-master
deed.description: Preparations for the Four Farthings Brewing-moot are complete!
deed.objectives: You have aided Carlo Blagrove (1) You have aided Barmy Rootknot and Gerd Whitfoot (1) You have aided Ponto Hopsbloom (1) You have aided Gunderic Grubb (1) You have aided Halson Tubwort (1)

deed.name: Enmity of the Wolves
deed.description: Wolves have long been a scourge of the peaceful people of the Shire. In hard winters, they may come down from the North to prey upon livestock and to threaten the hobbits themselves in vicious packs. More recently, it seems that greater numbers have moved south, and there are rumours that they are being driven this way by goblins or even more sinister forces.

deed.name: Enmity of the Wolves II
deed.description: While wolves are often hostile, most folks just consider them to be dangerous predators rather than a true danger. Nowadays, though, one has to wonder...they are wandering down from the north in large packs, and they seem more than just hungry -- there are rumours that many of these packs were bred by the goblins in the north-lands to be particularly vicious and dangerous towards Men and hobbits and to ruin the herds of livestock upon which many of the towns of Eriador depend for their food.

deed.name: Enmity of the Wolves III
deed.description: The stories say that back in old Bullroarer's time, the arrival of Golfimbul's goblins were presaged by an invasion of wolves much like the one people are seeing these days. That cannot be a good sign.

deed.name: Enmity of the Spiders
deed.description: While no respectable hobbit has ever had much to do with spiders, it seems of late that new breeds of the horrid things -- far larger than any proper spider ought to be -- have been migrating here from somewhere across the mountains to the East. For reasons unknown, these unpleasant creatures appear to have developed a great dislike for hobbits, making them quite a hazard for Little Folk living out on the edges of the Shire or beyond.

deed.name: Enmity of the Spiders II
deed.description: Where have these horrors come from? What ever happened to nice little garden spiders eating flies and all that? These days your idea of a spider starts at about two feet across and goes up from there -- hardly the kind of thing you would expect to encounter in the cozy Shire, yet now they seem to be common in all the forests of Eriador. It is enough to make even the most staid and placid hobbit sit up and take notice that things are getting rather queer these days.

deed.name: Enmity of the Spiders III
deed.description: From your youth you recall an old Elven tale of some great spider that tried to devour all the light in the world...and how though she was driven off and disappeared forever, her brood was left to swarm and multiply in dreadful, dark places. You remember how that tall-tale used to send a chill down your spine every time your dad told it -- but with all that you have seen of late, you wonder if maybe there might be some truth to it....

deed.name: Enmity of the Goblins
deed.description: Of all the powers of the Enemy, the goblins are the only ones to have openly assaulted the Shire. They were defeated by Bullroarer Took many years ago -- but now the descendants of Golfimbul have again been seen near the bounds of your fair land, as well as many other places in the North. Hobbits have been called to take up arms again, and the Bounders have redoubled their training, lest they be caught unawares by these savage creatures.

deed.name: Enmity of the Goblins II
deed.description: It looks like the Shire will need a new 'Bullroarer' soon, because there is no doubt that goblins are in force upon the land once again. The Bounds of the Shire are no longer safe, and the thought of your peaceful folk facing a tide of these foul creatures unawares makes your skin crawl. There will have to be a reckoning soon enough if that is to be prevented.

deed.name: Enmity of the Dead
deed.description: Since the beginning of time, fell spirits, not the least of which were the Balrogs of Morgoth, roamed the shadow-realm in service to the Enemy. Through foul sorceries, these spirits may stir the decaying bones of fallen Men, becoming terrible wights. To the race of Men, whose spirits pass beyond the world when they die, these monsters are true abominations.

deed.name: Enmity of the Dead II
deed.description: It is said that when the Witch-king came to Angmar, he exerted dominion over many fell spirits of Morgoth and sent them from Angmar and Rhudaur to inhabit the Barrow-downs outside of Bree...the last bastion of the Rangers of Cardolan. In the Third Age, only the wights remain to tell of those evil days.

deed.name: Enmity of the Dead III
deed.description: Morgoth, Sauron, the Witch-king of Angmar, the terrible Gaunt-lords...all possess the sorcerous power to infuse the remains of the dead with fell spirits in service to the Enemy. Rumour speaks of haunted vales in the realm of Angmar inhabited almost wholly by these spirits and the fell wights they produce....

deed.name: Enmity of the Wargs
deed.description: Wargs are often deemed a scourge of Men because their preferred prey are the herds and livestock upon which many villages across Middle-earth so depend. In this regard they are much more a scourge than the lesser breeds of wolves, for Wargs are known to wantonly slaughter livestock even after they have sated themselves, leaving entire herds to rot.

deed.name: Enmity of the Wargs II
deed.description: Wargs are sometimes used by goblins as mounts to extend the range of their attacks against villages and settlements, for goblins are loathe to strike further than they can march in a single night and still return to the dark safety of their caves before morning comes.

deed.name: Enmity of the Wargs III
deed.description: It is unclear what the true relationship is between goblins and Wargs. Some say that they are allied against common enemies, while others believe that the goblins actively breed and raise the creatures for war. It seems likely that both stories are partly true -- long ago, perhaps, the goblins bred the Wargs, which in time escaped to form their own packs under the most powerful and intelligent leaders among their kind...and now these packs continue to work with the goblins out of convenience.

deed.name: Enmity of the Hillmen
deed.description: For many years there have been tribes of Men who have shunned the rule of Kings and the life of great cities and towns. While some of these might be called allies by the Men of Gondor or Rohan, far too often they fall under the sway of the Enemy, who plays upon their distrust of the great Kingdoms, or threatens them with hidden force, or sways them with false riches and power. Thus it has been that the Kingdoms of Middle-earth have often found themselves at war with the folk of the Hills when the Enemy rises -- and this age seems no exception.

deed.name: Enmity of the Hillmen II
deed.description: It seems that old superstitions and fear of the Enemy's dark power are what drive these Hillmen to flock to the banners of the Enemy -- ancient seeds sown long ago in the hearts of Men by the Dark Lord, that he might have willing servants to hand when he prepares to arise again. It has long been both the strength and downfall of Men that their hearts are their own, and that they may set their feet upon whatever path they choose....

deed.name: Enmity of the Goblins
deed.description: The goblins were created by Morgoth long ago, as captive Elves were tortured and twisted into mockeries of themselves and set upon the world as eternal enemies to their former kin. All that was good in them was turned to evil, and the Elves have striven for ages since to eradicate them from Middle-earth...to no avail.

deed.name: Enmity of the Goblins II
deed.description: Goblins are a mockery of life, twisted by the Enemy to serve unquestioningly as an endless supply of foot-soldiers in his wars. Luckily, the breeding of unquestioned loyalty has left them unimaginative and unskilled, making them no match for trained Elven warriors. Still, their numbers are vast, and if only one Elf falls for every hundred of their kind, it is a great loss.

deed.name: Enmity of the Goblins III
deed.description: It is uncertain what goblins think of Elves, as they are rarely willing to speak on the matter, save from the opposite end of a sharp implement. Are they at all aware of their distant ancestry, when they once lived among the Free Peoples? Do they hate the Elves because they are told to by their Dark Lord -- or is it because they remember something from long ago and strive to destroy you out of jealous hatred for your place in the light?

deed.name: Enmity of the Orcs
deed.description: Bred by the Enemy for war over land, the Orcs are larger and tougher than their goblin cousins, but their origins remain the same. Militant and brutish, they retain some native talent for the clever working of wood and metal, though they only apply this to the construction of weapons and other machines of war.

deed.name: Enmity of the Orcs II
deed.description: Unlike the goblins, the Orcs have been raised with a martial outlook and form the backbone of the Enemy's armies. They are neither cowards nor weaklings -- though they cannot hope to match the martial prowess of the Elves -- but their numbers and war industry are vast when motivated by their shadowy lords.

deed.name: Enmity of the Orcs III
deed.description: While Orcs dislike the sun nearly as much as their lesser brethren, the goblins, they have more tolerance for it and can be forced to endure it for a time when necessity -- or the lash of their masters -- demands. Despite this, it has long been an artifice of the Enemy to conjure forth vast clouds of smoke or darkness both to protect their troops from the rays of the sun and to conceal their movements from spies and scouts.

deed.name: Enmity of the Drakes
deed.description: Dragons were bred long ages ago to break the power of the Elves in the North -- and in this they succeeded with their vast power and cunning, acting as a deadly spearhead of the Enemy's armies that none could stand against. Like Elves, Dragons have never been numerous, and their savage demeanor means that few of their offspring ever reach adulthood. Their numbers have also dwindled in Middle-earth -- but recently many of the lesser drakes have been unleashed from Angmar, which is worrisome indeed, for if these lesser beasts have reappeared, can the Dragons be far behind? Regardless of the danger, these creatures must be destroyed!

deed.name: Enmity of the Drakes II
deed.description: Even with but a fraction of their elder kin's power, a drake is a deadly enemy indeed. Even among the Firstborn, it is a mark of honour to stand against such a creature victorious. No one knows from whence the drakes arose -- what creature did the Enemy find to twist into such a fearful shape and power as Dragon-kind? Their origins are hidden, even to the Elves.

deed.name: Enmity of the Dourhands
deed.description: The Dourhand dwarves appear to have turned their backs on the Free Peoples of Middle-earth and rebelled against the rightful rule of Durin's Folk.

deed.name: Enmity of the Dourhands II
deed.description: Jealous of the wealth and status of the Longbeards -- particularly since Durin's Folk reclaimed the Lonely Mountain -- the Dourhands have plotted to usurp their position as the leaders of the Dwarves of the Blue Mountains for many years now.

deed.name: Enmity of the Dourhands III
deed.description: Ever since the earliest records, history has been rife with stories of betrayal and tragedy. The rebellion of the Dourhands is just the latest chapter in this long and sorrowful litany. It is time to bring that chapter to an end....

deed.name: Enmity of the Goblins
deed.description: Goblins and dwarves have despised each other since they first set eyes upon one another. They are natural enemies both above ground and below, with the goblins' countless numbers crashing year after year against the tireless defences of the dwarves, wearing away at them like tides against rock.

deed.name: Enmity of the Goblins II
deed.description: The dwarves have always held the advantage over the goblins in terms of skill in battle as well as quality of weapons, armour, and fortifications. The goblins, however, have always held the advantage in numbers -- a rather vast advantage.

deed.name: Enmity of the Goblins III
deed.description: Goblins are an odd study in group-thought. As individuals, they are sniveling cowards who recoil from anyone who appears remotely stronger than themselves -- in large masses, they are known to hurl themselves with unthinking savagery onto pike and axe. The common wisdom is that in large groups the goblins in front simply have no choice, as they are pushed forward by the teeming masses behind them, and so they fight like cornered animals. From what you have seen, there may be some truth to this.

deed.name: Enmity of the Trolls
deed.description: Trolls are a particularly deadly threat to the dwarves. Capable of smashing the strongest fortifications and thriving in the dark underground domains where the sun poses no danger, they have often been used to spearhead major assaults against the dwarf-kingdoms.

deed.name: Enmity of the Trolls II
deed.description: Quite the opposite of goblins, most trolls have little cunning or intelligence of any kind. They are, however, almost mindlessly brave, crushing anything in their path with abandon. Only if they are badly injured are they likely to rebel -- though the sight of a Cave-troll running amok through its goblin handlers is enough to bring a chuckle to even the most hardened of veterans.

deed.name: Kill the Enemy's Leaders!
deed.description: Find and Defeat the leaders of the Free Peoples.

deed.name: Conquest of Ringdyr
deed.description: Slaughter the Marshals of the Free People who command Ringdyr!

deed.name: Conquerer of Tol Ascarnen
deed.description: Slaughter the Marshals of the Free People who command Tol Ascarnen!

deed.name: Conquerer of the Towers
deed.description: Two towers stand guard over the lands of the Ettenmoors. Slaughter the Marshals of the Free People who command them!

deed.name: Bastions of Hope
deed.description: Even in the blasted wastes of Angmar, there remain a few small bastions of resistance and valour to strive against the darkness. These outposts and camps lie hidden and well-defended in the hills of this dark land, lending aid to those who would take up arms against the powers in Carn Dûm.
deed.objectives: Lehmä-koti Aughaire Tyrn Lhuig Gabilshathûr Gath Forthnír

deed.name: The Circle of Despair
deed.description: The ancient fortress of the Witch King of Angmar is rumoured to be surrounded by eight dread towers within which his lieutenants resided during the long war with Arnor, weaving their dread magic there against the forces of the West.
deed.objectives: Minas Caul Minas Agar Minas Maur Minas Angos Minas Nîr Minas Deloth Minas Gularan Minas Dhem

deed.name: The Road to War
deed.description: There is a great road that leads through the wastes of Angmar to the very gates of Carn Dûm. It is along this road that the dark armies march forth to bring the Free Peoples of Eriador under the yoke of the Enemy.
deed.objectives: Skathmúr Bail Róva Bail Boglakh Mor Maudhúl Bail Dílas Gate of Shadows

deed.name: The Shadows of Angmar
deed.description: Unravel the the epic tale of the Shadows of Angmar.
deed.objectives: Book I - Stirrings in the Darkness (1) Book II - The Red Maid (1) Book III - The Council of the North (1) Book IV - Chasing Shadows (1) Book V - The Last Refuge (1) Book VI - The Fires in the North (1) Book VII - The Hidden Hope (1) Book VIII - The Scourge of the North (1)

deed.name: Wanderer of Evendim
deed.description:
The lands of Evendim -- once the capital of the North Kingdom of Arnor -- have long lay uninhabited by Men, besides small bands of scavengers and robbers who pick through the ancient ruins and tombs that lie along the edge of the great lake.

As the forces of the North are aroused for war, those who gain control over this ancient seat of power may gain a critical advantage in the conflict to come.

deed.name: Pilgrim of Evendim
deed.description:
In ages past, as the Kingdom of Arnor fractured into distrustful factions under the evil influence of Angmar, the capital city of Annúminas in Evendim lost influence and was eventually abandoned.

The capital was relocated to Fornost, which in time became the throne of the kingdom of Arthedain.

deed.name: Warden of Evendim
deed.description: Though there is no industry, agriculture, or indeed any great strategic bastion to be found in Evendim, it could nonetheless become a great symbol among the Men of the North were the great capital of Annúminas ever to rise again under the banner of the ancient kings.

deed.name: Limrafn-slayer
deed.description: The Limrafn are a lesser, weaker form of fell spirit. What draws them to Evendim in such numbers, not even the Elves can say.

deed.name: Limrafn-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: You have seen many of these strange lights in Evendim lately -- they seem almost to be multiplying with the presence of Men and other forces. Is it possible that these strange entities are being awakened or attracted by the skirmishes being fought in this land, which was once nearly desolate and empty?

deed.name: Gauradan-slayer
deed.description: Folk tales have long spoken of werewolves stalking the night -- but now that you have met the Gauredain, you suspect you know more of the truth of these tales. If they are Men, then they are only barely so. They are greater than most Men in stature, yet hunched over and using only primitive tools and speech and often dressing in the skins of wolves.

deed.name: Gauradan-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: If the Gauredain were known to the ancient Kings of Arnor, few tales survive to this day that speak of them. More likely it seems that these savage Men wandered down into Evendim from the far north from Forochel.

deed.name: Giant-slayer
deed.description: A tribe of Stone-giants appears to have taken up residence in the western hills above Evendim. While not so great in stature as their legendary cousins in the Misty Mountains, they are nevertheless powerful opponents when aroused and more than a match for any lone soldier.

deed.name: Giant-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: No-one seems to know where the allegiance of the giants lies -- indeed, it seems likely that they serve none but themselves given their capricious nature. Nevertheless, should these lands fall to the Enemy, the giants would doubtless be pressed into his service as terrible soldiers.

deed.name: Goblin-slayer
deed.description: The scourge of the goblins appears to be everywhere these days, even on the borders of the Shire itself. Rumour has it that in Evendim a new breed of the foul creatures can be found in the odd-looking Boggarts -- cowardly snivelling things that hunt in packs to bring down their prey.

deed.name: Goblin-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: It seems that the goblins in southern Evendim have not yet come in great numbers, perhaps they are only here to harry the folk of the Shire and distract the Rangers from more important goals elsewhere? Nonetheless, the goblins use deep tunnels to move about beneath the sight of the keenest-eyed scout, so they can come forth suddenly in great numbers to wreak havoc upon the unprepared.

deed.name: Kergrim-slayer
deed.description: The Kergrim are yet another mystery of the lands of Evendim. The Rangers seem to believe that they are a distant cousin of the snow-beasts that range throughout the Misty Mountains, but none can say why they would be here -- or what power has twisted them into these hideous shapes. The implication is that the hand of the Enemy is at work here, somehow, but there is no clear evidence of his power here, otherwise.

deed.name: Kergrim-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Many of the foul Kergrim appear to have infested the valley in which the tombs of the ancient Dúnedain kings can be found. No doubt the Rangers of the North are enraged by the potential desecration of their ancestors' tombs by these beasts, but they can spare few men to root them out.

deed.name: Salamander-slayer
deed.description: The Salamanders of Evendim have always been a rare sight. This odd offshoot of the family of dragons has a strong affinity for fire, which it wields with abandon against any enemy that disturbs it.

deed.name: Salamander-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Oddly, Salamanders are frequently found near bodies of water such as rivers or lakes -- though they may also be found in wet marshes or sandy deserts. Scholars believe this may be because of the creature's tendency to burn away all nearby vegetation, thus rendering an area uninhabitable unless bodies of water or otherwise fire-proof terrain serves to constrain the fires they so freqently set.

deed.name: Tombs of Evendim
deed.description:
The kings of Annúminas were intered within tombs along the road to the gate of the city.

Nine were the kings that ruled over Arnor from this ancient seat of power, but not all of them were buried in the Way of Kings...
deed.objectives: Haudh Eärendur Haudh Elendur Haudh Valandur Haudh Elendil Haudh Tarondor Haudh Eldacar Haudh Tarcil Haudh Arantar

deed.name: Ruins of Evendim
deed.description: Explore the ruins of ancient Arnor.
deed.objectives: Tham Nambarth Tham Varan Ost Heryn Tham Andalath Tham Ornen Barad Rath Rantost Tollobel

deed.name: Wilds of Evendim
deed.description:
Once the capital of the North, Evendim has nonetheless always had its wild places and mysteries -- and those have grown stranger and more dangerous still in the long years since Annúminas was abandoned.

Far across the waters of lake Evendim lie lands long unexplored by Men.
deed.objectives: Nan Orngon Tûm Fuin The Even-rills The Eavespires The Eave-mere Swiftbrook The Twisted Grove Rushingdale

deed.name: Threatening Cluck
deed.description: Use your threatening cluck skill on creatures throughout Middle-earth.
deed.objectives: Enter session play Use skill: Threatening Cluck (25)

deed.name: Executioner of the Wicked
deed.description: Among the rotting horrors of the Barrow-downs, a gathering of corrupt and evil creatures holds sway over a black court. You must find and slay each of these evil abominations if there is to be any hope of wresting the grip of darkness from this once-hallowed place.
deed.objectives: Defeat Brishzel in the barrow of Haudh Nogbenn (1) Defeat Umnen in the barrow of Ringdor (1) Defeat Fergandir in the barrow of Haudh Iarchith (1) Defeat Faegfaer in the barrow of Goetham (1) Defeat Marrow in the barrow of Haudh Methernil (1) Defeat Gwigon in the barrow of Taradan (1)

deed.name: Nemesis of the Fallen
deed.description: The recently unsealed barrow of Haudh Iarchith has been found to be inhabited by hateful Barrow-spirits. Those who fight to defeat these spirits and return them to the final rest they have escaped will be recognized by the grateful folk of Breeland.

deed.name: Nemesis of the Fallen (Advanced)
deed.description: The recently unsealed barrow of Haudh Iarchith has been found to be inhabited by hateful Barrow-spirits. Those who fight to defeat these spirits and return them to the final rest they have somehow escaped will be recognized by the greatful folk of Breeland.

deed.name: Brood-hunter
deed.description: The evil spider Gwigon has made its lair amongst the twisting barrow of Taradan, and there her brood multiplies. They seek to ensnare any living thing foolish enough to wander in amongst the bones and dust of long-fallen princes.
deed.objectives: Defeat Barrow-spiders in the barrow of Taradan (150)

deed.name: Brood-hunter (Advanced)
deed.description: The evil spider Gwigon has made her lair among the twisting barrow of Taradan, and there her brood multiplies. They seek to ensnare any living thing foolish enough to wander in among the bones and dust of long-fallen princes.
deed.objectives: Defeat Barrow-spiders in the barrow of Taradan (300)

deed.name: Grave-digger
deed.description: The scent of grave-soil lingers ever present in the air of Haudh Iarchith, offering constant reminder of how many lay buried within its twisting corridors -- though it seems now that few of them lay resting as they were meant to....

deed.name: Grave-digger (Advanced)
deed.description: The scent of grave-soil lingers ever present in the air of Haudh Iarchith, offering constant reminder of how many lay buried within its twisting corridors -- though it seems now that few of them lay resting as they were meant to....

deed.name: Master of Beasts
deed.description: Many wild beasts stalk the ruins of Sarnúr, but these creatures have been enslaved or twisted to the will of Angmar through the cunning devices of the goblins, who breed and cruelly torment them. Many now act as spies and guards for the Dourhands and must be destroyed, lest they be unleashed into the lands of Ered Luin to wreak mischief and havoc upon its peoples.

deed.name: Master of Beasts (Advanced)
deed.description: Many wild beasts stalk the ruins of Sarnúr, but these creatures have been enslaved or twisted to the will of Angmar through the cunning devices of the goblins, who breed and cruelly torment them. Many now act as spies and guards for the Dourhands and must be destroyed, lest they be unleashed into the lands of Ered Luin to wreak mischief and havoc upon its peoples.

deed.name: Betrayer's Bane
deed.description: The dwarf-ruins of Sarnúr have been discovered and occupied by the Dourhands, who plan to use them as a base from which to strike at the Longbeards -- worse yet, they have allied themselves with evil and corrupted creatures who owe their true allegiance to the powers of Angmar. You must take your battle against the Dourhands onto the crumbling streets of Sarnúr before they build their strength and are bolstered further by forces sent from Angmar.

deed.name: Betrayer's Bane (Advanced)
deed.description: The dwarf-ruins of Sarnúr have been discovered and occupied by the Dourhands, who plan to use them as a base from which to strike at the Longbeards -- worse yet, they have allied themselves with evil and corrupted creatures who owe their true allegiance to the powers of Angmar. You must take your battle against the Dourhands onto the crumbling streets of Sarnúr before they build their strength and are bolstered further by forces sent from Angmar.

deed.name: Avenger of Sarnúr
deed.description: An alliance of enemies plots against Ered Luin from within the ancient ruins of Sarnúr, as the traitorous Dourhands seek to bring an array of forces to bear against their hated cousins the Longbeards. They seek to claim legitimacy by holding the seat of an ancient dwarf-city, but their presence in the company of such evils only defiles the sanctity of their ancestors.
deed.objectives: Defeat Brúllug in the ruins of Sarnúr (1) Defeat Glúmir in the ruins of Sarnúr (1) Defeat Latub in the ruins of Sarnúr (1) Defeat Northpaw in the ruins of Sarnúr (1) Defeat Icerender in the ruins of Sarnúr (1) Defeat Gâdhûp in the ruins of Sarnúr (1)

deed.name: Troll-kicker
deed.description: It seems that the trolls inhabiting Sarnúr are of a particularly dim-witted -- if brutal -- strain. With hearts of hard-edged ice, they will destroy anything that stands in their way unless you can stop them.

deed.name: Troll-kicker (Advanced)
deed.description: It seems that the trolls inhabiting Sarnúr are of a particularly dim-witted -- if brutal -- strain. With hearts of hard-edged ice, they will destroy anything that stands in their way unless you can stop them.

deed.name: The Forbidding Heights
deed.description: While most folks sensibly stay home and tend to fields and shops, some hardy adventurers are drawn to the most inhospitible and difficult places in Middle-earth. Few such places pose so great a challenge as the stretch of the Misty Mountains surrounding the region of the High Pass, which is fraught with hazards -- both natural and otherwise -- to test the most rugged individuals.
deed.objectives: Cirith Daur The Black Crack Dómstoll Erforgh Cleft Writhenbores Starkhath Hrimbarg Akûltot

deed.name: Goblin-town
deed.description: Few know the full extent of the depths of Goblin-town, and those who have experienced them most likely died therin as slaves to cruel goblin-overseers. The goblins themselves may not know all the ways, for the deepest passages extend far into the heart of the Misty Mountains where dark and unseen terrors lie, and the goblins will not brave these passages unless driven or enraged.
deed.objectives: War Steadings Thundergrot Slave Pens Gollum's Cave The Great Goblin's Den The Deep-fires Eglanúr

deed.name: The Wilds of Tâl Bruinen
deed.description: The southern Trollshaws are dominated by the Wilds of Tâl Bruinen. Few even amongst the Elves live here now, and the forested hills have become heavily overgrown and inhabited mostly by wild beasts that pose a constant danger to travellers and the few who try to eke out an existence in these undisciplined lands.
deed.objectives: Cirith Ulunn Echad Candelleth Eryn Singor Echad Gauradan Torech Ullug Delossad

deed.name: Bilbo's Buttons
deed.description: How strange...scattered throughout the warrens of Goblin-town seem to be a set of old, well-worn brass buttons, as if lost from a Hobbit's waistcoat. How in the world did such things come to be in these dark and twisted tunnels?
deed.objectives: Find the stained button Find the tarnished button Find the polished button Find the scratched button Find the bent button Find the shiny button Find the broken cufflink Find the blackened cufflink

deed.name: Craban-slayer
deed.description: Defeat crebain in the Lone-lands.

deed.name: Craban-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many crebain in the Lone-lands.

deed.name: Troll-slayer
deed.description: Defeat Trolls in the Lone-lands.

deed.name: Troll-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many Trolls in the Lone-lands.

deed.name: Mentor of Song
deed.description: You must train pupils in the art of music and song, ensuring that the most ancient traditions of Middle-earth may continue unbroken.
deed.objectives: Teach the art of music to your fellows (3)

deed.name: Exemplar of Song
deed.description: You must further your tutoring of students who will follow the tradition and art of music in Middle-earth.
deed.objectives: Teach the art of music to your fellows (9)

deed.name: The Shadows of Angmar - Part II
deed.description: Unravel the the epic tale of the Shadows of Angmar.
deed.objectives: Epic - Book IX: The Shores of Evendim (1) Epic - Book X: The City of the Kings (1) Epic - Book XI: Prisoner of the Free Peoples (1) Epic - Book XII: The Ashen Waste (1) Epic - Book XIII: Doom of the Last-king (1) Epic - Book XIV: The Ring-forges of Eregion (1) Epic - Book XV: Daughter of Strife (1)

deed.name: The Seven Swords
deed.description: Seven swords have been stolen from Krúslë Lannan and must be returned to their proper resting place.
deed.objectives: Recover the Sword of Abb from Owen (1) Recover the Sword of Kolmak from Ruraikh (1) Recover the sword of Ánraig from Tobaid (1) Recover the sword of Guinokh from Brekhin (1) Recover the sword of Innis from Dugald (1) Recover the sword of Kevoka from Frangan (1) Recover the sword of Mánas from Huisdán (1)

deed.name: Inn League Challenge
deed.description: To truly become a respected member of the Inn League, you must sample all the local beers, ales and wines found throughout Eriador. Seek out all of these beverages to earn the respect of the League.
deed.objectives: Use Blagrove's Brown Use Old Winyards Use Limael's Vintage Use Beakbreaker Ale Use Toad's Tongue Ale Use Forsaken Ale Use Swill Use Forsaken Cider Use Old Withywindle Use Brandy Wine Use Green Dragon's Breath Ale Use 1404 Vintage Reserve Use Thistlebelly Brew Use Whitebranch Use Wooly-foot Stout Use Barliman's Best Use Blind Troll Stout Use Moor-boar Beer Use Stars of Old Cider Use Isenwine Use Dorwinion Red Use Dorwinion White Use Bombur's Beard Lager

title.name: Inn League Sage of Fine Spirits

deed.name: Inn League Member
deed.description: It wasn't easy, but you have passed the grueling Inn League Initiation.

deed.name: Inn League Notable
deed.description: To become more respected by the Inn League, you must help other members of the League.
deed.objectives: Participate in Inn League events and endeavours (11)

deed.name: Senior Inn League Member
deed.description: To become more respected by the Inn League, you must help other members of the League.
deed.objectives: Participate in Inn League adventures and endeavours (5)

deed.name: The Battle for Forochel
deed.description: Discover each of the key battlegrounds for control of the Ice Bay of Forochel.

deed.name: Ancient Stones of Forochel
deed.description: While the Lossoth of Forochel are not great builders, the dwarves long ago had many mines and encampments in the North.
deed.objectives: Kibilzahar The Ironspan Zigilgund The Lonesome Stones Icereave Mines

deed.name: Forochel Expeditionary
deed.description:
The Lossoth of Forochel are engaged in a constant struggle against their enemies the Gauredain, against the savage northern wild-life, and against the elements themselves.

While one might expect them to receive help gratefully, this constant hardship has also bred a strong independence among their people -- it will take a great deal of effort to win them over to the cause of the Free Peoples of Eriador.

deed.name: Forochel Survivor
deed.description: The greatest danger in Forochel is the harsh environment itself. The bitter winds and ice have torn the life from more hardy folk than the claws of the kalpa-kita or spears of the Gauredain -- though those dangers come a close second.

deed.name: Forochel Pioneer
deed.description: The brutal wilderness of Forochel would keep all but the hardiest at bay, but for those with the spirit to endure and thrive in its environment, its call may prove irresistable at the last.

deed.name: Angmarim-slayer
deed.description:
So it seems that the shadowy fingers of Angmar have stretched even into desolate Forochel, sewing the seeds of conflict here as in all places they touch.

Here at least, it seems that their preparations are less ready than elsewhere, or perhaps they find little of value, for they rely mostly on their less trustworthy allies -- the Dourhands and the savage Gauredain -- rather than their well-ordered hordes of Orcs and evil Men.

deed.name: Angmarim-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: It seems that the Angmarim may at best be searching for something, or perhaps simply meddling in the conflicts between the Lossoth and the Gauredain. A full-strength invasion does not seem to be their purpose in Forochel -- at least, not yet.

deed.name: Dourhand-slayer
deed.description:
Old dwarf-ruins litter the landscape of Forochel. Being the hardiest of the Free Peoples, the dwarves claim that they were the first to settle here long ago, in hopes of finding riches beneath the frozen earth -- but most of these settlements were abandoned long ago.

Hoping to strengthen their claims as legitimate heirs of the ancient Dwarf-lords, the Dourhands seek to re-build these settlements with the aid of their Angmarim allies, but this has brought their cousins the Longbeards north as well, seeking to dispute their claims, no matter the worth (or lack thereof) of the mines here.

deed.name: Dourhand-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: The attempts by the Dourhands to claim a legitimate descent from the Dwarf-lords of old seems futile at this point, as their dark alliance with Angmar becomes more common knowledge among the dwarves of Middle-earth -- but if anything, this turn of events has only made them more dangerous and desperate, as they now fight for the very survival of their misguided house.

deed.name: Gauradan-slayer
deed.description: At last you have come upon the homeland of the Gauredain -- and in seeing it, it becomes clear how they came to be such powerful brutes, shaped by the vicious elements and hardships of Forochel, it is hard to imagine them otherwise -- and yet the Lossoth still maintain the trappings of civilization under the same hardships. Have the Gauredain chosen their path in this fashion, or is their brutal path some long-ago contrivance of the Enemy?

deed.name: Gauradan-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: It seems odd indeed that two people such as the Gauredain and the Lossoth should do battle to claim such a forbidding and difficult land as Forochel, and yet they strive endlessly over it. It seems that home is the place you know, and wherever that might be, Men, dwarves, hobbits, Elves, Orcs -- and whatever else -- will fight to defend it.

deed.name: Grim-slayer
deed.description: The Gauredain believe that the Grims are the wandering souls of those among their people who were cast out for their cowardice, damned to eternally wander the frozen snow-fields after they froze to death in the ice. Those few among the wise who know of these creatures, however, suspect that they are more likely fell spirits left wandering the northern wastes long after the fall of their ancient Dark Lord.

deed.name: Grim-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: If there is the slightest trace of a once-living spirit within the Grim, it would seem that it is not enough to show any sign of compassion or mercy. At the slightest sign of warmth or life they strike, seemingly intent on snuffing it out in a howling assault of hail and hatred.

deed.name: Sabre-tooth Slayer
deed.description: These savage cats are predators of a particularly vicious and undiscerning nature. The Lossoth make sure to respect their territory during the hunt, lest they become a meal for these deadly creatures. Likewise what livestock they raise is under constant threat by these voracious beasts.

deed.name: Sabre-tooth Slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: The sabre-tooth cats are a deadly and frequent hazard of the forests of Forochel. Only the bravest hunters amongst the Lossoth will dare to hunt in the vicinity of a Sabertooth den, and even they occasionally fail to return.

deed.name: Worm-slayer
deed.description: The Worms of Forochel have adapted to the eternally cold environment, growing a coat of strangely-furred scales to ward off the cold, while their claws and teeth carry a strange cold of their own, often causing those who suffer wounds from them to succumb to a deadly chill.

deed.name: Worm-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: It is uncertain whether these worms are native to Forochel or whether they have come down from the Northern Wasteland during the winter when the Ice Bay is frozen solid enough to travel across. Of course, it no longer matters from whence they came, for they are here now and a threat to all who live in Forochel.

deed.name: The Lost Fellowship
deed.description: The Lost Fellowship was a brave party that set off from Angmar to find a great treasure in Forochel. Unforuntately, they encountered some trouble along the way....
deed.objectives: Aid the Champion, Déornyd (1) Aid the Guardian, Nef (1) Aid the Burglar, Warstang (1) Aid the Captain, Reginald Ward (1) Aid the Hunter, Thurmaer (1) Aid the Lore-master, Cenlieg (1) Aid the Minstrel, Burgthryth (1)

deed.name: The Salmon King
deed.description: Only the most skilled - and lucky - fisher can make a catch of this size!

deed.description: Defeat beasts in Urugarth.

deed.objectives: Collect Marching Orders, Page 7 Collect Marching Orders, Page 5 Collect Marching Orders, Page 14 Collect Marching Orders, Page 1 Collect Marching Orders, Page 9 Collect Marching Orders, Page 16

deed.name: The City of Orcs
deed.description: This district of Carn Dûm, now called Urugarth, fell to ill-repair due to the foul waters pouring from the sewers of the seat of Angmar. Urugarth was given to the Orcs of Angmar and set as a staging point from which its terrible army could march.
deed.objectives: Dushkal's Lair Lhugrien's Roost Lagmas' Court Fell-water Falls Urugarth Kennels Asht-Shâpol

deed.name: The Foul Idols of Urugarth
deed.description: Found along the streets and alleys of Urugarth, these foul idols can act as beacons to alert Lagmâs' soldiers to the presence of intruders. Destroying them may raise the ire of the Orcs in Urugarth.
deed.objectives: South-western Foul Idol Southern Foul Idol Central Foul Idol Northern Foul Idol North-western Foul Idol

deed.name: The Enemy's Stronghold
deed.description: Once the seat of power from which the Witch-king's army marched upon the kingdom of Arnor, Carn Dûm now exists as the primary bastion of the Steadfast of Angmar.
deed.objectives: Slave-pens Barashal's Domain Fell-water Source Duvárdain Quarter Castle of Carn Dûm Seat of the Witch King Witch King's Watch

deed.description: Defeat the champions of Carn Dûm.

deed.description: Defeat the champions of Carn Dûm.
deed.objectives: Defeat Sálvakh (1) Defeat Azgoth (1) Defeat Avalgaith (1) Defeat Tárlakh (1)

deed.description: Defeat Angmarim in Carn Dûm.

deed.objectives: 39 Brown Trout 39 Bull Trout 39 Cutthroat Trout 39 Redband Trout 39 Speckled Trout 39 Red-spotted Trout 39 Rainbow Trout 39 Golden Trout 39 Lake Trout

deed.objectives: 39 Redfin Darter 39 Greenfin Darter 39 Longfin Darter 39 Orangefin Darter 39 Bandfin Darter 39 Blackfin Darter 39 Bloodfin Darter 39 Firebelly Darter 39 Splendid Darter

deed.name: Invaders from Angmar
deed.description: Defeat Angmarim in and around Annúminas.

deed.name: Invaders from Angmar (Advanced)

deed.name: The City of the Kings
deed.description: Explore the ruins of the ancient city of Annúminas.
deed.objectives: Gwaelband Gaerannon Echad Garthadir Menelband Clorhir Tirband Ariant Minathranc

deed.name: Warden of Annúminas
deed.description: Your efforts within Annúminas have not gone unnoticed by the Rangers. Because of your unceasing aid in the defence of the City of the Kings, they have bestowed upon you the title of Warden.

deed.name: Markers of the Sunken City
deed.description: Find the marker plaques scattered throughout Annúminas.
deed.objectives: Collect Plaque of Menelband Collect Plaque of Minathranc Collect Plaque of Tirband Use Plaque of Echad Garthadir Use Plaque of Clorhir Use Plaque of Ariant

deed.name: Spirits Aiding Angmar (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat the Dead within Annúminas.

deed.name: Battle Acumen
deed.description: Master your understanding of battle and the space in which it takes place so that you can end battles more swiftly in the future.
deed.objectives: Strike with Battle Acuity or Enhanced Battle Acuity (300)

deed.name: Mighty Blast
deed.description: You must master your horn-blowing technique to use the horns of the South Kingdom.

deed.name: Improved Rend
deed.description: Practice your attacks which cause bleeding in your foes.

deed.name: Tight Grip
deed.description: Practice your weapon-recovering strike; it could save your life...or a friend's.
deed.objectives: Strike with Hedge or Improved Hedge (200)

deed.name: Athletic
deed.description: Build your sprinting stamina with focused training.

deed.name: Bountiful Mercy
deed.description: Learn to identify the turning point in a foe's strength and strike.

deed.name: Controlled Fury
deed.description: Master self-control, and many techniques will be possible that were not before.

deed.name: Vigour of Champions
deed.description: Use the defeat of your foe to fuel your attack against the next.

deed.name: Alert Guard
deed.description: You must master the art of the guarding blow, which strikes and defends at once.

deed.name: Strength from Within
deed.description: Master drawing greater strength from the courage you share with your fellows.

deed.name: Tactical Prowess
deed.description: Master the call to arms and the empowerment of your shield-brother.

deed.name: Battle-master
deed.description: Press the advantage against your foe and strike when the time is right.
deed.objectives: Strike with Devastating Blow or Pressing Attack (300)

deed.name: Composure
deed.description: You must learn to make the most of personal sacrifice to be of the greatest aid to your fellows and your cause.
deed.objectives: Use the Time of Need skill (50)

deed.name: Adherent of Elendil
deed.description: Invoke the name of Elendil, the Elf-friend and king of old, and let his example guide your blade.

deed.name: Deeds before Words
deed.description: Be an example to your shield-brother, and you will find your inspiration greater still.

deed.name: Relentless Optimism
deed.description: Study how encouraging words may sometimes yield very great changes in the hearts of your fellows.
deed.objectives: Use Words of Courage or Rallying Cry (250)

deed.name: Precise Ally
deed.description: You must field your archer to practice his art in order to cultivate greater skill and precision.

deed.name: Enduring Morale
deed.description: Increase your vigour and find greater well-springs of spirit within yourself.

deed.name: Flow of Harmony
deed.description: Train to perform your heroic tales with less effort but equal effect.

deed.name: Improved Herald's Strike
deed.description: Be a herald of your opponent's defeat.
deed.objectives: Complete Herald's Hammer (1) Use Herald's Strike (250)

deed.name: Lyrics of Bravery
deed.description: Become a master of your own will, and you will not so easily fall under the sway of others.

deed.name: Improved Echoes of Battle
deed.description: Let the calls of battle echo from the hills and mountains in a great clamour.
deed.objectives: Use Melody of Battle, Echoes of Battle or Timeless Echoes of Battle (250)

deed.name: Improved Raise the Spirit
deed.description: Master the words that may raise the spirits of those who stand upon the edge of despair.
deed.objectives: Use any version of Raise the Spirit (500)

deed.name: Improved Song of Soothing
deed.description: Train yourself to diminish your appearance in the eyes of your foe.

deed.name: Power of Song
deed.description: Cultivate the endurance to last through any conflict.

deed.name: The Study of Frost-lore
deed.description: Knowledge of the natural world has given you subtle influence over its natural fluctuations, but there is deeper knowledge still to be gleaned through study.

deed.name: Improved Sign of Power: Command
deed.description: You have heard that there may be a more complete form of the sign you uncovered previously.
deed.objectives: Strike with Sign of Power: Command (350)

deed.name: The Secret of Tar
deed.description: Refine the quality of your sticky mixtures to make them easier to prepare.

deed.name: The Study of Fire-lore
deed.description: Knowledge of the natural world has given you subtle influence over its natural fluctuations, but there is deeper knowledge still to be gleaned through study.

deed.name: The Study of Wind-lore
deed.description: Knowledge of the natural world has given you subtle influence over its natural fluctuations, but there is deeper knowledge still to be gleaned through study.

deed.name: Improved Sign of Battle
deed.description: Continue your study of ancient signs and the power they represent.
deed.objectives: Strike with Sign of Battle: Wizard's Fire (750)

deed.name: Improved Storm-lore
deed.description: Knowledge of the natural world has given you subtle influence over its natural fluctuations, but there is deeper knowledge still to be gleaned through study.

deed.name: Improved Inner Flame
deed.description: Channeling your Inner Flame takes great effort and concentration, but the reward can be quite enlightening.

deed.name: Blocking Force
deed.description: Practice opening your opponent's guard and learn how to gain further advantage from it.

deed.name: Hit Where It Hurts
deed.description: A well-placed strike can throw your opponent off-balance.

deed.name: Raw Power
deed.description: Practice assuming an aggressive stance and learn how to make it stronger still.

deed.name: Final Straw
deed.description: Practice harrying your foes, encouraging them to expose their vulnerabilities.

deed.name: Litany of Challenge
deed.description: Master the goading of your foes...train to draw and hold their ire ever longer.

deed.name: Quick of Foot
deed.description: Practise your stamp to interrupt your foes, for using the skill repeatedly will help you to perform it with greater ease in the future.

deed.name: Shield of Fire
deed.description: Taunt your foes without relent, for you know they would not spare you or your allies the blade.

deed.name: Threatening Presence
deed.description: Cultivate a threatening demeanor and practice the imposing art of putting your shield into your enemy's face.

deed.name: Cruel Odds
deed.description: To better twist chance in your favour, you must first master the art of piling victory on top of success.
deed.objectives: Achieve a critical hit with any skill unlocked by a critical hit (200)

deed.name: Even the Odds
deed.description: Make the most of successful coordination with your allies, be it to strike fast or ready an escape.
deed.objectives: Use the Seize Initiative or Escape Clause skills (35)

deed.name: Honed Wit
deed.description: With practice, the right comeback may no longer require a mind set only to mischief.

deed.name: Sharp Wit, Sharp Blade
deed.description: You must master the combination of a cutting remark and a marking cut.

deed.name: Spatial Sense
deed.description: No matter how well-placed the strike, there is always room for improvement.

deed.name: Strategic Planning
deed.description: If you can internalize the age old maxim, you may find the right location easier to arrive at and more effective than before.
deed.objectives: Use the Location is Everything skill (200)

deed.name: Complicated Terms
deed.description: You have picked up a few new conundrums in your travels, but you will not be able to polish the weaker points until they fall flat a few times.
deed.objectives: Target must resist your <a href="/wiki/Skill:Riddle">Riddle or Confound skills (75)

deed.name: Confound the Fools
deed.description: You have come to believe that confusion is only scratching the surface. With a bit of work, you could stupify them where they stand.

deed.name: Heart of the Bard
deed.description: Follow in the steps of Bard himself and the servants of evil may grow to fear your name as well.
deed.objectives: Complete Shot Through the Heart (1) Strike with Heart Seeker (50)

deed.name: Barbed Hinderance
deed.description: Train hard to improve the snare on your Barbed Arrow, to help keep your prey at a comfortable distance from you.
deed.objectives: Strike foes with your Barbed Arrow (750)

deed.name: Combat Traps
deed.description: Master the art of trap-setting to be able to deploy them no matter the distractions.
deed.objectives: Complete Sturdy Traps (1) Use your Set Trap or Set Snare skills (100)

deed.name: Critical Eye
deed.description: Develop the eye to spot and target the weak points of your foes more reliably.
deed.objectives: Achieve critical hits with your bow (1000)

deed.name: Shot through the Heart
deed.description: Earn a name for yourself and improve the reliability of your most deadly attack.

deed.name: Strong Intimidation
deed.description: Strike fear into the heart of your enemies and learn what it is that makes them flee.
deed.objectives: Strike with Bard's Arrow or Cry of the Predator (300)

deed.name: The Quality of Mercy
deed.description: The quality of your shot must not strain your bow. The strain on your target is another matter altogether.
deed.objectives: Achieve critical hits with Merciful Shot (150)

deed.name: Resolute Aim
deed.description: Cultivate the precise and dextrous movements to draw and fire at speed, no matter the distraction.

deed.name: Strong Voice
deed.description: Let loose the cry of war and see your enemy's resolve erode.

deed.name: Confidence
deed.description: In the face of your confidence, let your opponent's own surety drain away.

deed.name: Deadly Thrust
deed.description: Your spear-thrust will weaken your foe's armour.
deed.objectives: Strike with The Dark Before Dawn (250)

deed.name: Efficient Thrust
deed.description: A fast and simple attack may allow your efforts to be spent elsewhere.

deed.name: Expert Hurler
deed.description: In the way of the spear, one always desires to have the option of using the best attack at the right time.

deed.name: Find Weakness
deed.description: A well-placed hit may be reveal your foe's weaknesses.
deed.objectives: Achieve critical hits with Critical Strike (75)

deed.name: Force of Personality
deed.description: Lead with the fist, and the rest will follow.
deed.objectives: Strike with Surety of Death, Resolution, or Spear of Virtue (500)

deed.name: Master of the Fist
deed.description: Master the Way of the Fist.
deed.objectives: Strike with Exultation of Battle or Desolation (500)

deed.name: Master of the Spear
deed.description: Master the Way of the Spear.
deed.objectives: Strike with Mighty Blow, Wall of Steel, or Boar's Rush (500)

deed.name: Mighty Throw
deed.description: The point may always be made sharper.
deed.objectives: Complete Expert Hurler (1) Strike with Ambush (350)

deed.name: A Keen Response
deed.description: A fast and simple attack may allow your efforts to be spent elsewhere.

deed.name: Skill and Power
deed.description: Even a routine attack may become more powerful.

deed.name: Terrible Visage
deed.description: Let your enemy look upon your face and see the fear spread across theirs.

deed.name: Never Say Die
deed.description: Take respite, however brief, and you can fight on.

deed.name: Perseverance
deed.description: Take your foe off their feet to allow yourself to recover.

deed.name: Deadly Insult
deed.description: Do not allow your foe to think of any target but yourself.

deed.name: Efficient Shield-work
deed.description: Bring up your shield and never let it falter.

deed.name: Know Your Enemy
deed.description: Taunt your foe into error.

deed.name: Master of the Shield
deed.description: Master the Way of the Shield.
deed.objectives: Strike with Shield Mastery, Celebration of Skill, or Dance of War (500)

deed.name: Shield-trickery
deed.description: Present your foe with your shield...to his face.

deed.name: Skillful Blocking
deed.description: Blocking is an art cultivated with practice.

deed.name: Wary Blocks
deed.description: Strike with your defence foremost in your mind.

deed.name: Master of Connotation
deed.description: Your understanding of inference and connotation is improved by your foe's lack of understanding.

deed.name: Linnod of Peace
deed.description: Improve your collection of pacifying and calming texts.
deed.objectives: Complete Linnod of Subtlety (1) Use Calming Verse (250)

deed.name: Master of Tragedy
deed.description: Your studies in the construction of tragedy can have tremendous impact upon your foes.
deed.objectives: Critical Hits with Fury of the Storm skills (500)

deed.name: Frost-burn
deed.description: Use of offensive writs may reveal the sympathies and shared nature between the two.
deed.objectives: Strike with Writ of Fire or Writ of Cold (200)

deed.name: Overflowing Confidence
deed.description: You draw strength from within and find motivation that will carry you further than before.

deed.name: Confounding Principles
deed.description: Improve the effect your touch can have upon your foe.

deed.name: Linnod of Subtlety
deed.description: There are ways you can put an aggressive bent to your soothing letters, allowing your invectives to burn as hot, but anger less.

deed.name: The Prophetic Word
deed.description: Practice the art of casting your vision forwards, and you shall be able to do it with greater frequency.

deed.name: Tale of Rage
deed.description: Learn to let your temper loose in your writing, and it shall burn through to your foes.
deed.objectives: Strike with Wrath of Flame skills (500)

deed.name: Conflagration of Runes
deed.description: With practice, you can kindle flame from fragments faster and with less effort.

deed.name: Scathing Retort
deed.description: Kindle the fires of your passion to increase your art's impact.

deed.name: Writ of Blazing Fire
deed.description: Your fires can burn longer still, if you only find the right words.

deed.name: Icy Discourse
deed.description: The bite of cold can fade swiftly or slow. It is a matter of practice to let it linger.

deed.name: Terse Narrative
deed.description: You are able to convey epic meaning through fewer words.

deed.name: Memorable Prose
deed.description: Achieve greater heights of healing while practicing the inscription of words of healing and restoration.

deed.name: Rune of Endurance
deed.description: Increase the resiliency of your Rune of Restoration.

deed.name: Author of Exaltation
deed.description: Increase the protection offered by your Word of Exaltation with a dedicated inscription.

deed.name: Master of Allusion
deed.description: Your ability to write between the lines confounds your foes.
deed.objectives: Use any Words of Grace skills (200)

deed.name: Harsh Debate
deed.description: Learn how to unsettle your foe with your unrelenting assertions.

deed.name: Closing Remarks
deed.description: Study how to make an epic conclusion to your arguments.

deed.name: Thunderous Words
deed.description: The spark may light the way to greater things.

deed.name: Winter-storm
deed.description: Your narratives combine the chill of a winter night and the turbulence of the fiercest storm.
deed.objectives: Use Fury of the Storm or Chill of Winter skills (500)

deed.name: The Mines of Moria
deed.description: Delve deep into the ruined halls of Moria and face the threats that lie within.
deed.objectives: Complete Book I of "The Mines of Moria" (1) Complete Book II of "The Mines of Moria" (1) Complete Book III of "The Mines of Moria" (1) Complete Book IV of "The Mines of Moria" (1) Complete Book V of "The Mines of Moria" (1) Complete Book VI of "The Mines of Moria" (1)

deed.name: The Path of the Mischief-maker
deed.description: You have begun to follow the Path of the Mischief-maker. If you follow this path to its end, you may learn how to become a master of mischief, increasing your abilities to distract foes in combat.
deed.objectives: Begin down the Path of the Mischief-maker (1) Complete the quest 'Bag of Tricks' (1) Complete the quest 'Tracking Treasure' (1) Complete the quest 'A Startling Twist' (1)

deed.name: A Guide to the Quiet Knife
deed.description: You have heard it whispered that the libraries of Moria yet contain many tomes, while many other volumes were brought by the dwarves seeking to reclaim their kingdom of old. One such tome in the libraries of the Iron Garrison is said to be the legendary "A Guide to the Quiet Knife." If you can gain enough favour with the Iron Garrison Guards, they may let you have their copy of this book.
deed.objectives: Achieve level 58 Use A Guide to the Quiet Knife

deed.name: The Mines of Moria
deed.description: Delve deep into the ruined halls of Moria and face the threats that lie within.
deed.objectives: Complete Book I of "The Mines of Moria" (1) Complete Book II of "The Mines of Moria" (1) Complete Book III of "The Mines of Moria" (1) Complete Book IV of "The Mines of Moria" (1) Complete Book V of "The Mines of Moria" (1) Complete Book VI of "The Mines of Moria" (1)

deed.name: The Path of the Healing Hands
deed.description: You have begun to follow the Path of the Healing Hands. If you follow this path to its end, you may learn how to better restore the morale and vigour of your companions in combat.
deed.objectives: Begin down the Path of the Healing Hands (1) Complete the quest 'A Cry of Vengeance' (1) Complete the quest 'Rallying Cry' (1) Complete the quest 'Routing Cry' (1)

deed.name: The Master of the Charge
deed.description: You have heard it whispered that the libraries of Moria yet contain many tomes, while many other volumes were brought by the dwarves seeking to reclaim their ancient home. One such tome in the libraries of the Iron Garrison is said to be the legendary "The Master of the Charge." If you can gain enough favour with the Iron Garrison Guards, they may let you have their copy of this book.
deed.objectives: Achieve level 58 Use The Master of the Charge

deed.description: Delve deep into the ruined halls of Moria and face the threats that lie within.
deed.objectives: Complete Book I of "The Mines of Moria" (1) Complete Book II of "The Mines of Moria" (1) Complete Book III of "The Mines of Moria" (1) Complete Book IV of "The Mines of Moria" (1) Complete Book V of "The Mines of Moria" (1) Complete Book VI of "The Mines of Moria" (1)

deed.name: The Path of the Martial Champion
deed.description: You have begun to follow the Path of the Martial Champion. Mastery of the arts found along this path will allow you to suffer the most cruel attacks and remain in the fight.
deed.objectives: Begin down the Path of the Martial Champion (1) Complete the quest 'Controlled Burn' (1) Complete the quest 'Getting Strong Now' (1) Complete the quest 'Glory' (1)

deed.name: The Boiling Rage
deed.description: You have heard it whispered that the libraries of Moria yet contain many tomes, while many other volumes were brought by the dwarves seeking to reclaim Moria. One such tome in the libraries of the Iron Garrison is said to be the legendary "The Boiling Rage." If you can gain enough favour with the Iron Garrison Guards, they may let you have their copy of this book.
deed.objectives: Achieve level 58 Use The Boiling Rage

deed.name: The Mines of Moria
deed.description: Delve deep into the ruined halls of Moria and face the threats that lie within.
deed.objectives: Complete Book I of "The Mines of Moria" (1) Complete Book II of "The Mines of Moria" (1) Complete Book III of "The Mines of Moria" (1) Complete Book IV of "The Mines of Moria" (1) Complete Book V of "The Mines of Moria" (1) Complete Book VI of "The Mines of Moria" (1)

deed.name: The Path of Freedom's Defender
deed.description: You have begun to follow the path of the Freedom's Defender. If you follow this path to its end, you will find that your already considerable ability to survive attacks in a fight much improved.
deed.objectives: Begin down the Path of Freedom's Defender (1) Complete the quest 'Thrill of Danger' (1) Complete the quest 'Litany of Defiance' (1) Complete the quest 'Salt the Wound' (1)

deed.name: A Keen Blade
deed.description: You have heard it whispered that the libraries of Moria yet contain many tomes, while many other volumes were brought by the dwarves seeking to reclaim their ancient realm. One such tome in the libraries of the Iron Garrison is said to be the legendary "A Keen Blade." If you can gain enough favour with the Iron Garrison Guards, they may let you have their copy of this book.
deed.objectives: Achieve level 58 Use A Keen Blade

deed.description: Delve deep into the ruined halls of Moria and face the threats that lie within.

deed.name: The Path of the Foe-trapper
deed.description: You have begun to follow the Path of the Foe-trapper. If you follow this path to its end, you will find your distracting shots will have grown in power, helping you gain a welcome reprieve in a prolonged fight.
deed.objectives: Begin to follow the Path of the Foe-trapper (1) Complete the quest 'Blindside' (1) Complete the quest 'Passage of Foes' (1) Complete the quest 'Strength of the Earth' (1)

One such tome in their libraries is said to be the legendary "The Jolly Hunter." If you can gain enough favour with the Iron Garrison Guards, they may let you have their copy of this book.

deed.description: You have begun to follow the Path of the Ancient Master. If you follow this path to its end, you will gain insight into the events surrounding you and see how they will end.
deed.objectives: Begin down the Path of the Ancient Master (1) Complete the quest 'Beacon of Hope' (1) Complete the quest 'Share the Power' (1) Complete the quest 'Knowledge of the Lore-master' (1)

One such tome in the libraries of the Iron Garrison is said to be the legendary "The Book of Nature." If you can gain enough favour with the Iron Garrison Guards, they may let you have their copy of this book.

deed.name: The Mines of Moria
deed.description: Delve deep into the ruined halls of Moria and face the threats that lie within.

deed.name: The Path of the Resolve-watcher
deed.description: You have begun to follow the Path of the Resolve-watcher. If you follow this path to its end, you will be better able to aid your companions in a prolonged fight, giving them the resolve necessary to meet the challenge they are facing.
deed.objectives: Begin down the Path of the Resolve-watcher (1) Complete the quest 'Triumphant Spirit' (1) Complete the quest 'Song of the Hopeful Heart' (1) Complete the quest 'Echoes of Battle' (1)

One such tome in the libraries of the Iron Garrison is said to be the legendary "The Verses of the North." If you can gain enough favour with the Iron Garrison Guards, they may let you have their copy of this book.

deed.description: Delve deep into the ruined halls of Moria and face the threats that lie within.

deed.name: The Path of the Restoring Rune
deed.description: You have begun to follow the Path of the Restoring Rune. If you follow this path to its end, you will gain greater insight into various runes, allowing you to be more of a strengthening aid to your companions in difficult fights.
deed.objectives: Begin to follow the Path of the Restoring Rune (1) Complete the quest 'Prelude to Hope' (1) Complete the quest 'Rousing Words' (1) Complete the quest 'A Rune of Restoration' (1)

One such tome in the libraries of the Iron Garrison is said to be the legendary "On the Patterns of Wind and Rain." If you can gain enough favour with the Iron Garrison Guards, they may let you have their copy of this book.

deed.description: Delve deep into the ruined halls of Moria and face the threats that lie within.

deed.description: You have begun to follow the Path of the Masterful Fist. If you follow this path to its end, you will learn how to draw the ire of your enemies, keeping your companions safe.
deed.objectives: Begin to follow the Path of the Masterful Fist (1) Complete the quest 'Goad' (1) Complete the quest 'Forced March' (1) Complete the quest 'Offensive Strike' (1)

deed.description: You have heard it whispered that the libraries of Moria yet contain many tomes, while many other volumes were brought by the dwarves seeking to reclaim their ancient realm. One such tome in the libraries of the Iron Garrison is said to be the legendary "The Path Less Trod." If you can gain enough favour with the Iron Garrison Guards, they may let you have their copy of this book.
deed.objectives: Achieve level 58 Use The Path Less Trod

deed.name: The Great Delving
deed.description: Explore the Great Delving of Moria.
deed.objectives: Durin's Threshold Dolven-view The Dwarf-lords' Gate The Lonely Span The Stone Council Gazatmur Shemeldurj The Palace of Náin

deed.name: The Ring Goes South
deed.description: Find important locations along the path of the Company of the Ring through Eregion.
deed.objectives: Burnt Tor Find the Caradhras campfire Find the Sirannon Gate Find the High Hollin campsite Find the Tâl Caradhras campsite

deed.name: Silent and Restless
deed.description: Elrond of Rivendell has sent scouts into Eregion to cover the path of the Company of the Ring and also to drive forth the spies of Saruman the White from the ancient home of the Noldor in Middle-earth.

deed.name: Silent and Restless (Intermediate)
deed.description: Elrond of Rivendell has sent scouts into Eregion to cover the path of the Company of the Ring and also to drive forth the spies of Saruman the White from the ancient home of the Noldor in Middle-earth.

deed.name: Silent and Restless (Advanced)
deed.description: Elrond of Rivendell has sent scouts into Eregion to cover the path of the Company of the Ring and also to drive forth the spies of Saruman the White from the ancient home of the Noldor in Middle-earth.

deed.name: Silent and Restless (Final)
deed.description: Elrond of Rivendell has sent scouts into Eregion to cover the path of the Company of the Ring and also to drive forth the spies of Saruman the White from the ancient home of the Noldor in Middle-earth.

deed.name: Craban-slayer
deed.description: Defeat crebain in Eregion.

deed.name: Craban-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many crebain in Eregion.

deed.name: Dunlending-slayer
deed.description: Defeat Dunlendings in Eregion.

deed.name: Dunlending-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many Dunlendings in Eregion.

deed.name: Half-orc Slayer
deed.description: Defeat half-orcs in Eregion.

deed.name: Half-orc Slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many half-orcs in Eregion.

deed.name: Uruk-captains of Eregion
deed.description: Defeat the Uruk-leaders in Eregion.
deed.objectives: Defeat Logon (1) Summon and defeat Fauldush (1) Summon and defeat Shatogtar (1) Defeat Pizumu the Spy-master (1) Summon and defeat Gâmzhurm, Lord of Porth Cadlus (1) Summon and defeat Akashpug, Chief of Târ Stazg (1) Summon and defeat Râkhuga the Tracker (1)

deed.name: Lizard and Crawler-slayer
deed.description: Defeat lizards and crawlers in Eregion.
deed.objectives: Defeat Lizards and Crawlers in Eregion (120)

deed.name: Lizard and Crawler-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many lizards and crawlers in Eregion.
deed.objectives: Defeat lizards and crawlers in Eregion (240)

deed.name: Wolf and Warg-slayer
deed.description: Defeat wolves and Wargs in Eregion.
deed.objectives: Defeat wolves and Wargs in Eregion (120)

deed.name: Wolf and Warg-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many wolves and Wargs in Eregion.
deed.objectives: Defeat wolves and Wargs in Eregion (240)
