deed.description: Explore the Flaming Deeps of Moria.
deed.objectives: Anazârmekhem The Burning Stair The Crossroads of Ash Gate of the Seven Fathers Hadâd-mezer Hurmulkezer Hudnul-meden

deed.name: The Redhorn Lodes
deed.description: Explore the Redhorn Lodes of Moria.
deed.objectives: The Orc-watch The Gate of Ruin Sigin-tharâkh The Tailing Pit Menem-mezel Malmezel Ashpar's Command Budkhul-beken

deed.name: Zelem-melek
deed.description: Explore the region of Zelem-melek within Moria.
deed.objectives: The Twenty-first Hall Mudmul-charâf Hall of Flowing Water Gabil-mamach Chamber of Mazarbul Gabil-hul The Great Hall of Durin Uzbad-bakân

deed.name: Eastern Durin's Way
deed.description: Explore the eastern extents of Durin's Way in Moria.
deed.objectives: Jazârgund Skoiruzg Hadâd-dûm Fehem-dûm Tith-maudhûl Gríshurbhrum Khulturg Dâr-rukh

deed.name: Western Durin's Way
deed.description: Explore the western area of Durin's Way in Moria.
deed.objectives: The Chamber of the Crossroads The Hall of the High Stair Gloku-ru Ninknakh Faltor Tharâkh Bazân Salab Nurjundul Uflûmp-mur

deed.name: Nud-melek
deed.description: Explore the area of Nud-melek which encompases the eastern halls of Moria.
deed.objectives: The First Hall Khadar-zarâm The Deep Crossroad Khurjezer The Bridge of Khazad-dûm The Bridge of Khazad-dûm Sudulthurkh

deed.name: The Water-works
deed.description: Explore the Water-works of Moria.
deed.objectives: The Rotting Cellar The Great Wheel Durin's Beard The Lost Palace The Chamber of the Pool The Chamber of Dark Waters The Lost Treasury Narag-kheleb Harâzgund The Chamber of Memory

deed.name: The Foundations of Stone
deed.description: Explore the Foundations of Stone in Moria.
deed.objectives: The Shadowed Refuge The Endless Stair The Bridge-shard Zabad-fakâk Dalgum-ru

deed.name: The Silvertine Lodes
deed.description: Explore the Silvertine Lodes of Moria.
deed.objectives: The Deep Descent Gamil Filik Menem-berej Menem-munz

deed.name: Deep-claw Slayer
deed.description: Deep-claws and cave-claws infest the Mines of Moria in overwhelming numbers, harrying efforts to reinstate the great dwarf-realm that once was. A great service will be done for the dwarves should the presence of the vermin be lessened in the mines.

deed.name: Deep-claw Slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: To further hinder the spread of the vile deep-claws will indeed be a boon to the efforts of the dwarves in Khazad-dûm. The creatures waylay any explorers brave enough to venture into the halls, and they ever befoul the passages with their filth.

deed.name: Dragonet-slayer
deed.description: Dwelling in the dark places of Moria are the miniscule dragonets, a severely stunted form of Dragon-kind, hardly larger than a common bat. These evil creatures have proven to be a terrible annoyance to the dwarves struggling to reclaim their home of old.

deed.name: Dragonet-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Your efforts have done much already to purge Moria of the vile dragonets, but to eliminate yet more would be a relief beyond compare. No Dragon, no matter its size or shape, should be permitted to defile the great halls of the dwarves.

deed.name: Globsnaga-slayer
deed.description: Orcs infest the long, winding passages of Khazad-dûm, but a greater threat has arisen: the Globsnaga, Orcs infested by a vile fungus.

deed.name: Globsnaga-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: You have defeated a great number of the Globsnaga, the fungus-infested Orcs of Moria, and still you remain standing, having resisted the disease that wreaths these foes. They must be destroyed to the last, for the plague they bear is a perilous invention of the Enemy.

deed.name: Grodbog-slayer
deed.description: Great insects, the gredbyg, have been drawn to the vast dark of Moria like moths to a flame. They lurk in the gloom, ready at any time to ambush travellers unlucky enough to be caught at unawares upon the ever-turning paths.

deed.name: Grodbog-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Now that some cleansing has been done against the vile insects of Moria, the effort must be ever maintained. Gredbyg do not ever truly leave a place, but their numbers should be quelled, lest the caves are overrun once more. To prevail against the gredbyg of Moria will be a tireless task.

deed.name: Morroval-slayer
deed.description: The merrevail of Angmar are wretched creatures, corrupted beyond recall. They rejoice only in gloom and misery and seek always to destroy all that is light. Even the oppressing dark of Moria is not enough to quench their thirst for blackness and despair.

deed.name: Morroval-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: The wretched bat-creatures are much put upon to withstand valour such as yours, for you have defeated many merrevail thus far. The tunnels have been lit by the hewing of such dark and fell beings.

deed.name: Nameless-slayer
deed.description: The Nameless seem to be corrupted creatures of an earlier age, though from what source their corruption comes or what they once were, none can say. They are deadly foes and attack without discrimination, hungry for the blood of any that wander too near their grasp.

deed.name: Nameless-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: You have defeated many Nameless foes, but their threat in Moria is hardly lessened. Any who combat these terrible beings are worthy of the strength they will gain from such an effort.

deed.name: Spider-slayer
deed.description: Spiders are among the most vicious, cruel, and evil of all the creatures of Middle-earth. Countless lairs have been spun in the dark of Khazad-dûm, blotting out what little light remains in those desolate places.

deed.name: Spider-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: To show no mercy to the spiders of Middle-earth is to do a great deed, but nothing can stem their ever-growing presence save ceaseless vigilance in the slaughter of these horrific foes.

deed.name: Troll-slayer
deed.description: Trolls, with their thundering footsteps and mighty fists, pace the halls of the dwarves, destroying the artistry of many years with the careless thrashing of their hulking forms.

deed.name: Troll-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: It takes a stout-hearted warrior to fell a troll who has many times the girth and might of even the doughtiest of Men. Though you have taken down enough already to earn yourself a title befitting of your righteousness, to defeat yet more would surely increase your strength in battle.

deed.name: Warg-slayer
deed.description: The silence of Moria can be terrifying, but more terrifying still is the howl that shatters the stillness. Wargs hunt in the darkness, aiding the evil purposes of the Orcs and goblins who dwell with them.

deed.name: Warg-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: You have done much to silence the ominous braying of the Wargs in the Mines of Moria, but their presence will remain strong unless further action is taken against them. Further hunting of the fierce, slavering beasts would be a great help to the dwarves trying to re-establish themselves in the lost halls of Khazad-dûm.

deed.name: Thunder and Flame
deed.description:
The first four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Angmar, Eregion, and Moria. The last four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Forochel, Moria, and the Misty Mountains.

Thunder and Flame was scribed by a Rune-keeper of ancient Khazad-dûm, known to have been an advisor to King Durin himself. It is said that this ancient tome held many secrets of the Angerthas, passed down from the earliest days in the First Age. It speaks at length of the subtleties of the Cirth script, and how to draw forth the powers of the elements: of fire and storm and winter's chill, for use against one's enemies.

In the end, however, even this vastly complex might was not enough to sate the greed of the dwarves, nor prevent the destruction wrought upon Moria by the awakening of the ancient evil that slumbered in the deep.
deed.objectives: Collect Thunder and Flame Talk to Elrond Half-elven at the Last Homely House in Rivendell. Collect Thunder and Flame, Page 3 Collect Thunder and Flame, Page 8 Collect Thunder and Flame, Page 12 Collect Thunder and Flame, Page 19 Collect Thunder and Flame, Page 23 Collect Thunder and Flame, Page 26 Collect Thunder and Flame, Page 34 Collect Thunder and Flame, Page 42

trait.name: You Shall Fall to our Wrath

deed.name: Golu o Maeth
deed.description:
The first four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Angmar, Eregion, and Moria. The last four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Forochel, Moria, and the Misty Mountains.

Golu o Maeth was composed, it is said, by a great scholar of ancient Doriath. It is one of the oldest translations of the fundamentals of Rune-craft, an examination of the Tengwar in particular and their relationship to the powers of combat. This lore was thought lost after the destruction of Beleriand, though rumors persisted that at least one copy was brought east of the Ered Luin before then. Age has not been kind to this volume, however, and many of its pages have crumbled to dust. Even so, Elrond of Rivendell would certainly regard it as a relic beyond compare.
deed.objectives: Collect Golu o Maeth Talk to Elrond Half-elven at the Last Homely House in Rivendell Collect Golu o Maeth, Page 7 Collect Golu o Maeth, Page 8 Collect Golu o Maeth, Page 12 Collect Golu o Maeth, Page 18 Collect Golu o Maeth, Page 19 Collect Golu o Maeth, Page 22 Collect Golu o Maeth, Page 24 Collect Golu o Maeth, Page 31

deed.name: Whispers in the Dark
deed.description:
The first four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Angmar, Eregion, and Moria. The last four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Forochel, Moria, and the Misty Mountains.

'Whispers in the Dark,' one of the strangest books ever written, was actually penned by a Rune-keeper of the race of Man, not an Elf or dwarf. He hailed from Rhudaur not long before its fall in the war between Arnor and the forces of the Witch-king. Its pages discuss the powers of the class no Man has ever been able to follow, much less master. The writing is mad, scribbled in wild, uneven runes in a disorganized manner upon stained pages, many of which are loose leaves simply stuffed into the book. The writer was driven to madness by seeking the secrets of Rune-craft, but rumour has it that great and terrible discoveries were recorded in this text. The book's spine is cracked and weak, and only the first half of its pages cling, yellowed and fragile, to this withered binding. Elrond would yearn to know what the lost pages contain.
deed.objectives: Collect Whispers in the Dark Talk to Elrond Half-elven at the Last Homely House in Rivendell. Collect Whispers in the Dark, Page 3 Collect Whispers in the Dark, Page 8 Collect Whispers in the Dark, Page 13 Collect Whispers in the Dark, Page 15 Collect Whispers in the Dark, Page 18 Collect Whispers in the Dark, Page 25 Collect Whispers in the Dark, Page 32 Collect Whispers in the Dark, Page 39

deed.name: The Watch Against the Night
deed.description:
The first four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Angmar, Eregion, and Moria. The last four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Forochel, Moria, and the Misty Mountains.

Gondolin of old was home to the most legendary Marchwardens of the Elder Days. This tome is an account told by a scribe of those brave Elf-warriors during the long wars against Morgoth. Much of it is a heroic epic, told in linnod-verse, describing multiple forays from the great city into the realms of the Enemy. As with all tales of those times, however, it soon becomes a tragedy; one by one the Wardens were lost, many slain, and some were taken and broken in the dungeons of Morgoth. Many of the tactics passed down to the Wardens of today began with this book, which ends suddenly with the tragic fall of the great city.
deed.objectives: Collect The Watch Against the Night Talk to Aragorn in Rivendell Collect The Watch Against the Night, Page 5 Collect The Watch Against the Night, Page 7 Collect The Watch Against the Night, Page 13 Collect The Watch Against the Night, Page 17 Collect The Watch Against the Night, Page 21 Collect The Watch Against the Night, Page 25 Collect The Watch Against the Night, Page 41 Collect The Watch Against the Night, Page 44

deed.name: Chieftains of the Dúnedain
deed.description:
The first four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Angmar, Eregion, and Moria. The last four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Forochel, Moria, and the Misty Mountains.

Chieftains of the Dúnedain was a series of annals kept by the Rangers of the North, recording the wisdom of every chief from Aranarth, the first, all the way to Arador. It has much to say of the early days of the Rangers, when they were at their most scattered after the fall of Arnor. It was lost, however, when Arador was slain by trolls in the wilds of the Ettenmoors. It is thought that he buried it before the battle that ended in his death, but none knew where. A new annal was kept beginning with his son, Arathorn II, but all the wisdom of the preceding chieftains vanished, presumably forever.
deed.objectives: Collect Chieftains of the Dúnedain Talk to Aragorn in Rivendell Collect Chieftains of the Dúnedain, Page 3 Collect Chieftains of the Dúnedain, Page 12 Collect Chieftains of the Dúnedain, Page 13 Collect Chieftains of the Dúnedain, Page 17 Collect Chieftains of the Dúnedain, Page 18 Collect Chieftains of the Dúnedain, Page 23 Collect Chieftains of the Dúnedain, Page 29 Collect Chieftains of the Dúnedain, Page 32

deed.name: Bullroarer's Boy
deed.description:
The first four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Angmar, Eregion, and Moria. The last four pages of this book can be found on enemies scattered across Forochel, Moria, and the Misty Mountains.

Written some two hundred years ago, "Bullroarer's Boy" was a fanciful journal kept by Haldemar Took, one of the younger sons of Bandobras Took. After the Battle of Greenfields, Haldemar became a Warden of the Shire, and told many Tall (or rather short) Tales of adventures beyond the Bounds, many of them humorous accounts of battle against goblins and trolls and other beasts, some wholly imagined. Though much of the book is whimsy, there is truth at the core that any Warden would value. Sadly, the three known copies of the book were all stolen, suspiciously, within a week of one another nearly a century ago.

deed.name: Defender of Caras Galadhon
deed.description: You have been granted a discount at all Lothlorien vendors.

deed.name: Wanderer of the Golden Wood
deed.description: The ways of Lothlórien are beautiful and restful. It is easy to lose oneself in the peaceful wood.
deed.objectives: Echad Andestel Lady's Rest Cerin Nauth The Vineyards of Lórien Imlad Lalaith The Garden of Memory Bain Gwaloth Sâd Gilthiriad Cerin Brethil The Quiet Garden

deed.name: City of the Lord and Lady
deed.description: Caras Galadhon is the mighty city of the Lord and Lady of the Galadhrim, nestled amid the tall mallorn trees.
deed.objectives: The House of Celeborn Galadriel's Garden Celúrlin The Company's Pavilion Telain Galadhrim Telain Bangad Telain Melthin Telain Glorelloth Telain Neduil

deed.name: Lórien Lookout
deed.description: Many flets, where the guards of the Galadhrim keep watch, dot the Golden Wood, ensuring that no enemy can approach unnoticed.
deed.objectives: Talan Fanuidhol Talan Gwilith Talan Dolinhen Talan Atharchen Talan Tirith Talan Orthelian Talan Mallelas Talan Brethil Talan Revail Talan Haldir Cerin Amroth, February 15th

deed.name: Great Deeds for Lothlórien
deed.description: There are many opportunities to perform great deeds for the Galadhrim of Lothlórien.
deed.objectives: Complete Wanderer of the Golden Wood (1) Complete Lórien Lookout (1) Complete City of the Lord and Lady (1) Complete Beast-slayer (Advanced) (1) Complete Orc-slayer (Advanced) (1)

deed.name: Friend of Lothlórien
deed.description: The Galadhrim are wary of strangers. It takes much to earn their trust.
deed.objectives: Become 'Known to the Galadhrim' (1) Complete 'The Paths of Caras Galadhon' (1)

deed.name: Beast-slayer
deed.description: Even the Elves recognize that wildlife unchecked can be as harmful to nature as wildlife slaughtered for no good reason.

deed.name: Beast-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Even the Elves recognize that wildlife unchecked can be as harmful to nature as wildlife slaughtered for no good reason.

deed.name: An Evil Reflection
deed.description:
Vile Wargs and fearsome merrevail darken Lumul-nar, the Hall of Mirrors. The light will not return here until the leaders of these evil creatures are dispatched.

This deed can only be completed in the group version of the instance.

deed.name: Lumul-nar Morroval-slayer
deed.description: The merrevail of Ergoth strive to keep the mirrors of Lumul-nar darkened.

deed.name: Lumul-nar Morroval-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: The merrevail of Ergoth strive to keep the mirrors of Lumul-nar darkened.

deed.name: Spring Sprung!
deed.description: Participate in the joyous festival to welcome the wonders of spring!
deed.objectives: Participate in the Spring Festival Complete The Chicken Dash (1) Complete A Last Laugh at the Lost (1) Complete Misplaced Companions (1) Complete The Green Challenge (1) Complete A Fool's Errand (1)

deed.name: Flet-runner Challenges
deed.description: A number of flet-runners throughout Caras Galadhon have challenged you to join their ranks by demonstrating your awareness of the city's layout and the quickness of your feet.
deed.objectives: Complete 'At Home Among the Trees' (1) Complete 'Flet-runner Challenge: Leginiel' (1) Complete 'Flet-runner Challenge: Lagordal' (1) Complete 'Flet-runner Challenge: Bregradel' (1) Complete 'Flet-runner Challenge: Lintwen' (1)

deed.objectives: Defeat Thrastar (1) Defeat Hergill (1) Defeat Agi Gatebreaker (1) Defeat Ghashnákh (1) Defeat Sigurmar (1)

deed.name: Trouble in Tuckborough
deed.description: The Great Smials are the capitol of the Shire, the home of the Thain, Paladin Took. Brigands and goblins in the service of Saruman the White seek to capture the Great Smials and throw down the Tooks.
deed.objectives: Stop Ghâshfog from digging into the Great Smials (1) Stop Murbarash from burning hobbit holes (1) Stop Fíthrokh from eating chickens (1) Defeat Oldroot at the Great Willow (1) Defeat Big Fright on the hillside. (1)

deed.name: Ford of Bruinen

deed.objectives: Defeat Zanúrz (1) Defeat Kunquin (1) Defeat Durkúf (1) Supply the archers Defeat Bruidagnir (1)

deed.name: Stand at Amon Sûl

deed.name: Mirkwood Tower Climber
deed.description: There are two major, surviving towers in the ruins of Ost Galadh: Minas Celebolf and Minas Glórelloth. From these pinnacles, much of the expanse of Mirkwood may be seen.

deed.name: Protector of the Vile Slayer
deed.description: Defeat a Protector of the Vile within a Skirmish.
deed.objectives: Defeat a Protector of the Vile in a Skirmish (1)

deed.name: Tutorial Offensive: Encounters
deed.description: You never know when you may run across a brigand of some repute.

deed.name: The Mightiest Arm
deed.description: You have demonstrated quite the talent for battering your opponents about.

deed.name: Why Your Head Hurts
deed.description: You have been roundly knocked about by your opponents.
deed.objectives: Successfully complete the Mightiest Blow -- Expert quest (25)

deed.name: Thievery and Mischief
deed.description: Bree-town has a long and storied history, but until this point had mostly escaped the ravages incurred upon the Southern lands.
deed.objectives: Defeat Lordfisher (1) Defeat Padfoot (1) Defeat Goretusk (1) Defeat Ned Ashleaf (1) Defeat Tom Greythistle (1) Defeat Túkar (1) Defeat Snagbúrz (1) Defeat Gruglup (1)

deed.name: Defence of The Prancing Pony
deed.description: The Prancing Pony Inn is a cornerstone of Bree-town. All who come through the village stop there for at least a pint, if not the night.
deed.objectives: Defeat Southpaw (1) Defeat the Old Hunter (1) Defeat Ufglup (1) Defeat Rat-catcher (1) Defeat Mukghashan (1) Defeat Kamhont (1) Defeat Banosnákh (1) Defeat Willie Hawthorn (1) Defeat Blackfeather (1)

deed.name: The Warden of the Dungeons
deed.description: The Warden of the Dungeons of Dol Guldur is a terrible Cargûl, rumoured to be one of the knights of Eärnur, last King of Gondor, lost at Minas Morgul.

deed.name: A Full Belly and a Nap in the Dirt
deed.description: One would think that Wargs on a full belly would be sluggish....
deed.objectives: Defeat Kranklob after allowing Wargs to eat all the meat slabs throughout the Warg-pits of Dol Guldur

deed.name: Enter the Chambers
deed.description: Sammath Gûl is a place of terror, inhabited by the sorcerer Gorothúl and the dread spirits which serve him.
deed.objectives: Defeat Urchír (1) Defeat Alagossír (1) Defeat Gorothúl (1)

deed.name: Throwing Down Sammath Gûl
deed.description: Sammath Gûl was once the private chambers of Sauron in his guise as the Necromancer...now they are held by his regent and his minions.
deed.objectives: Complete Enter the Chambers (1) Complete The Spirits are the Key (1) Complete Bringing Down the Enemy (1)

deed.name: Glory in the Sword-hall of Dol Guldur
deed.description: The minions of the Enemy train in the Sword-hall of Dol Guldur, improving their skills for the inevitable invasion of Lothlórien. They must learn just how lacking they are....
deed.objectives: Complete Enter the Arena (1) Complete Battle Royale (1)

deed.name: The Spirits are the Key
deed.description: Sammath Gûl is defended by many fell spirits of Morgoth in the service of Sauron.
deed.objectives: Defeat fell spirits in Sammath Gûl (20)

deed.name: The Battle of the Sword-hall of Dol Guldur
deed.description: Dol Guldur claims many champions, not the least of which are those who preside over the Sword-hall.
deed.objectives: Defeat all of the champions of the Sword-hall of Dol Guldur after challenging them all at once.

deed.name: Of Warg and Goblin
deed.description: The Warg-pits of Dol Guldur are overseen by the goblin Athgrat and the Warg Kranklob, vile servants of the Enemy.

deed.name: There is a New Warden in the Dungeons
deed.description: The Dungeons of Dol Guldur are presided over by a Cargûl known only as the Warden. This creature makes entry into and escape from the Dungeons nearly impossible.
deed.objectives: Complete The Warden of the Dungeons (1) Complete Liberation from the Merciless Dungeons (1) Complete Leave No One Behind (1)

deed.name: Liberation from the Merciless Dungeons
deed.description: The Dungeons of Dol Guldur are notorious for the dire horrors inflicted upon their prisoners. There, the mind of Thráin, father of Thorin Oakenshield, was broken.
deed.objectives: Complete the quest to free Hethulír (1) Complete the quest to free Bregrochon (1) Complete the quest to free Baingaleth (1) Complete the quest to free Thimuil (1) Complete the quest to free Glamrennel (1) Complete the quest to free Faelwen (1) Complete the quest to free Faenthír (1) Complete the quest to free Maediel (1) Complete the quest to free Borihon (1)

deed.name: Bringing Down the Enemy
deed.description: Gorothúl is protected by a fell spirit called Demafaer, a foul creature from beyond the Void.

deed.name: Leader of the Pack
deed.description:
Complete the following accomplishments:
- Of Warg and Goblin
- A Full Belly and a Nap in the Dirt
deed.objectives: Complete Of Warg and Goblin (1) Complete A Full Belly and a Nap in the Dirt (1)

deed.name: Enter the Arena
deed.description: The Sword-hall of Dol Guldur is presided over by many champions, who train the soldiers of the Enemy.
deed.objectives: Defeat Urcheron (1) Defeat Carchrien (1) Defeat Durkâr (1)

deed.name: Leave No One Behind
deed.description: The Dungeons of Dol Guldur are rumoured to be impregnable...but it is said that Gandalf the Grey twice entered that terrible place and escaped to tell of it.
deed.objectives: Rescue at least seven of the prisoners at once Defeat the Warden after freeing all of the prisoners in the Dungeons of Dol Guldur (1)

deed.name: Breaching the Necromancer's Gate
deed.description: The Necromancer's Gate guards the inner courtyards of the fortress of Dol Guldur.
deed.objectives: Defeat Lavalúg (1) Defeat Gortag (1) Defeat Firingúl (1) Defeat Murúk (1) Defeat Annoniel (1) Defeat Thrângund (1) Defeat Morgúr (1) Defeat Agardúr (1) Defeat Grishglok (1)

deed.name: Mirkwood Landing
deed.description: Aid the Malledhrim in securing their military objectives during the landing of their forces in Mirkwood.
deed.objectives: Complete any Mirkwood quest (1) Complete the Forerunners quest arc (1) Complete the Aiding the Fallen quest arc (1) Complete the final assault on the Orc fortress that controls the Mirk-eaves (1)

deed.name: Headcount
deed.description: The Malledhrim seek to drive back the forces of Dol Guldur from the eaves of Southern Mirkwood.

deed.name: Epilogue: Of Elves and Dwarves
deed.description: The tale of Moria and Lothlórien is nearing a close. What does the future hold for the Iron Garrison and the Golden Host?
deed.objectives: Complete 'Epilogue: Zigilburk Returned' (1) Complete 'Epilogue: Sigileth's Knives' (1) Complete 'Epilogue: Ningloril' (1) Complete 'Epilogue: Laeglang' (1) Complete 'Epilogue: Alfirimbes' (1) Complete 'Epilogue: Greyhammers' (1) Complete 'Epilogue: Cúcheron's Bow' (1) Complete 'Epilogue: Achardor's Fate' (1) Complete 'Epilogue: Barvessain' (1) Complete 'Epilogue: Braiglinn' (1) Complete 'Epilogue: Issuriel's Flower' (1) Complete 'Epilogue: Gorothúl of Dol Guldur' (1)

deed.name: Saviour of Khazad-dûm
deed.description: The Iron Garrison seeks to reclaim the Black Pit of Moria as their own, but many believe their expedition into the ancient halls may be doomed. Do all you can to help them, and you will be named the Saviour of Khazad-dûm.
deed.objectives: Complete The Watcher of Moria (1) Complete The Grand Stair (1) Complete Mastery Over Fear (1) Complete Persevering Against the Blight (1) Complete Marshal of the Burning Depths (1)

deed.name: Strike Against Dannenglor
deed.description: The ancient Elf-ruins of Dannenglor howl during the dark Mirkwood nights.
deed.objectives: Defeat Helchfaer (1) Defeat Ghostfang (1) Defeat Ruingalad (1) Defeat Swartclaw (1) Defeat Rimdeloth (1) Defeat Gorogmúl (1) Defeat Gothling (1) Defeat Fiklúk (1) Defeat Seregruin (1)

deed.name: Protectors of Thangúlhad
deed.description: Thangúlhad is an advance position of which the Golden Host has managed to wrest control from the forces of Dol Guldur.
deed.objectives: Defeat Borndol (1) Defeat Ruithroval (1) Defeat Azrí (1) Defeat Hokarul (1) Defeat Grudom (1) Defeat Frúzglob (1) Defeat Golugthrug (1) Defeat Lapus (1) Defeat Torúglup (1)

deed.name: The Battle in the Tower
deed.description: The tower is the pinnacle of the fortress of Dol Guldur. Its terrible shadow casts darkness and dread over the forests of Mirkwood.
deed.objectives: Defeat Thangaran (1) Defeat Iaerien (1) Defeat Hogaward (1) Defeat Múdku (1) Defeat Blord (1) Defeat Gundnákh (1) Defeat Gadhumúrz (1) Defeat Urbor (1)

deed.name: Assailant of the Dead -- Small Fellowship
deed.description: The servants of the Witch-king have long made the Barrow-downs a place of terror...now the time has come to drive forth that terror.
deed.objectives: Barrow-downs Defeat many denizens of the Barrow-downs (750)

deed.description: Mordor has sent forth many dire Lieutenants to lead the Dead of the Barrow-downs against the Free Peoples. The time has come to put an end to them.

deed.name: Strength of Endurance -- Fellowship
deed.description: The Enemy in the Barrow-downs is relentless, throwing themselves at their foes without regard to their lives...for they have no life.
deed.objectives: Survive in the Barrow-downs for five minutes Survive in the Barrow-downs for ten minutes Survive in the Barrow-downs for fifteen minutes Survive in the Barrow-downs for twenty minutes Survive in the Barrow-downs for twenty-five minutes Survive in the Barrow-downs for thirty minutes

deed.name: Sorcerer-slayer
deed.description: The servants of the Enemy are a formidable presence in Mirkwood as the Malledhrim press forward.

deed.name: Sorcerer-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: The servants of the Enemy are a formidable presence in Mirkwood as the Malledhrim press forward.

deed.name: Beast-slayer
deed.description: The many predators of Mirkwood are as black as the night itself, corrupted by the long years of evil.

deed.name: Beast-slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: The many predators of Mirkwood are as black as the night itself, corrupted by the long years of evil.
deed.objectives: Defeat many beasts in Southern Mirkwood (240)

deed.name: Assault on the Ringwraiths' Lair
deed.description: The Ringwraiths' Lair provides the final defences for the inner fortifications.
deed.objectives: Defeat Faelathron (1) Defeat Mazaukgrat (1) Defeat Kúfit (1) Defeat Durnákh (1) Defeat Gúlheryn (1) Defeat Afglu (1) Defeat Zánurz (1) Defeat Norchador (1) Defeat Mornákh (1)

deed.name: The Wilds of Mirkwood
deed.description: There are many wild and forsaken places to be stumbled upon as the wary wanderer passes through Mirkwood.

deed.name: Exploration from Top to Bottom
deed.description: The ruins of Minas Elendúr in Eregion and their under-cellars of Delotham have gone unexplored for long years since they were abandoned.
deed.objectives: Complete Chapter 6: Fúni Gem-cutter (1) Find the statue in the courtyard of Minas Elendúr Find the south-west corner of Minas Elendúr Find the enclosed porch in Minas Elendúr Find the circular courtyard in Minas Elendúr Find the south-east corner in Minas Elendúr Find the south-east aisle in Minas Elendúr Find the isolated chamber in Minas Elendúr Find the dimly-lit, pillared room in Minas Elendúr Find the windowed chamber in Minas Elendúr Find the room of doors in Minas Elendúr Find the room of dread in Minas Elendúr Find the northern room in Minas Elendúr Find the large balcony in Minas Elendúr Find the south-west corner of Delotham Find the illuminated room in Delotham Find the rubble-filled room in Delotham Find the buried room in Delotham Find the four-corridor junction in Delotham Find the illuminated bend in Delotham Find the central chamber in Delotham Find the collapsed corner in Delotham Find the sunken chamber in Delotham Find the northern chamber in Delotham

deed.name: The Library at Tham Mírdain
deed.description: The Library at Tham Mírdain was once one of the greatest repositories of the Elves' knowledge in Middle-earth. After Sauron's forces razed Eregion, much of that knowledge was lost.
deed.objectives: Complete Purging the Overmasters (1) Complete Matters of Knowledge (1) Complete Pillagers of Knowledge (1) Complete Chieftain Gûrsh (1) Complete Challenge: Chieftain Gûrsh (1) Complete Lore of the Forgotten Library (1) Complete Invaders of Tham Mirdain (Library) (1)

deed.name: The School at Tham Mírdain
deed.description: The School at Tham Mírdain once trained the mightiest Elf-smiths in Middle-earth. Much to their dismay, their learning was used against them when the Great Rings were created.
deed.objectives: Complete Musings and Teachings (1) Complete Blade of the Dunlending (1) Complete Biting the White Hand (1) Complete Chieftain Tarsh (1) Complete Flames of Knowledge (1) Complete Texts of the Crumbling School (1) Complete Invaders of Tham Mírdain (School) (1)

deed.name: Annuminas -- Glinghant
deed.description: The gardens of Glinghant were once one of the wonders of Annúminas, but have fallen into decay and corruption.
deed.objectives: Complete Impure Waters (1) Complete Keep it from the Enemy (1) Complete Darkest of Waters (1) Complete Glinghant Corrupted (1) Complete Challenge: Glinghant (1)

deed.name: Annuminas -- Ost Elendil
deed.description: Ost Elendil was once the palace of Elendil, first King of Westernesse in Middle-earth. Now it is home to great evil.
deed.objectives: Complete The Door-warden of the Inner Chamber (1) Complete Evil in Ost Elendil (1) Complete Blood-stained Runes (1) Complete Balhest, Lord of Ost Elendil (1) Complete Challenge: Balhest (1)

deed.name: Annuminas -- Haudh Valandil
deed.description: Haudh Valandil is the final resting place of Isildur's youngest son. Evil things now gnaw at its roots.
deed.objectives: Complete New Home for the Relics of Old (1) Complete The Kergrim Stalk Haudh Valandil (1) Complete Lights in Darkness (1) Complete End Dolvaethor's Menace (1) Complete Challenge: Valandil and Dolvaethor (1)

deed.name: Helegrod -- Drake Wing
deed.description: Helegrod was once an outpost of the great dwarf-realm of the Misty Mountains known to most as Moria. This wing is now home to a brood of drakes descended from the great dragon Thorog.
deed.objectives: Complete Challenge: Grisgart (1) Complete Drake-wrangler (1) Complete Keep Them from Hatching (1) Complete Fangs for Nothing (1)

deed.name: Helegrod -- Giant Wing
deed.description: Helegrod was once an outpost of the great dwarf-realm of the Misty Mountains known to most as Moria. Giants under the influence of Skorgrím Dourhand and the Angmarim now call this wing of the dwarf-hold home.
deed.objectives: Complete Giants in the Service of Angmar (1) Complete Giant-slayer (1) Complete Beasts of Snow (1) Complete Challenge: Storvâgûn (1)

deed.name: Helegrod -- Spider Wing
deed.description: Helegrod was once an outpost of the great dwarf-realm of the Misty Mountains known to most as Moria. Great spiders now infest many portions of the ancient dwarf-hold.
deed.objectives: Complete An Evil Place, Crawling with Spiders (1) Complete Zaudru's Brood (1) Complete Spider Squasher (1) Complete Challenge: Zaudru (1)

deed.name: Helegrod -- Dragon Wing
deed.description: Helegrod was once an outpost of the great dwarf-realm of the Misty Mountains known to most as Moria. This wing now serves as the tomb of the dragon Thorog.

deed.name: Mysteries of Enedwaith
deed.description: The Grey Company rides to the aid of their chieftain Aragorn in Rohan. While travelling through the sparsely inhabited region of Enedwaith, they uncover many strange mysteries.

deed.name: Dunlending-slayer
deed.description: Defeat Dunlendings in Enedwaith.

deed.name: Mysteries of Enedwaith (Intermediate)
deed.description: The Grey Company rides to the aid of their chieftain Aragorn in Rohan. While travelling through the sparsely inhabited region of Enedwaith, they uncover many strange mysteries.

deed.description: The Grey Company rides to the aid of their chieftain Aragorn in Rohan. While travelling through the sparsely inhabited region of Enedwaith, they uncover many strange mysteries.

deed.description: The Grey Company rides to the aid of their chieftain Aragorn in Rohan. While travelling through the sparsely inhabited region of Enedwaith, they uncover many strange mysteries.

deed.name: Path of the Grey Company
deed.description: Rangers of the North, kinsmen of Aragorn son of Arathorn, have ridden forth to their chieftain's aid. As they pass south to Rohan, scout the way ahead for the best roads.
deed.objectives: Echad Dagoras Echad Saeradan Echad Idhrenfair Echad Daervunn Harndirion

deed.name: Protector of Enedwaith
deed.description: You have put forth your best efforts to protect the peoples of Enedwaith against the evils which arose in their land.

deed.description: Defeat many wolves and Shadow-wolves in Enedwaith.

deed.description: Defeat many Dunlendings in Enedwaith.

deed.description: Defeat Wood-trolls in Enedwaith.

deed.description: Defeat many Wood-trolls in Enedwaith.

deed.name: Great Barrow -- The Gate to Sambrog
deed.description: Access to the depths of the Great Barrow and the gaunt-man Sambrog is gated by a key. One half lies within the maze, the other with Thadúr.
deed.objectives: Defeat Thadúr the Ravager and claim half of the key (1) Defeat Gaerdring and Gaerthel and claim half of the key. (1)

deed.name: Great Barrow -- Maze Wing
deed.description: The haunted tombs of the Barrow-downs are no place for a living mortal.
deed.objectives: Complete Grim Tomb-wight (1) Complete Crawling Arm (1) Complete Ancient Barrow-wights (1) Complete Ancient Flames (1) Complete Gaerdrel and Gaerthel (1) Complete Challenge: Gaerdrel and Gaerthel (1)

deed.name: Great Barrow -- Water Wing
deed.description: Rumour has it that a Gaunt-lord rules over this wing of Othrongroth.
deed.objectives: Complete Gaunt Battle-caller (1) Complete Chilled Barrow-wight (1) Complete Barrow-wight Bowlord (1) Complete Disturbed Remains (1) Complete Thadúr the Ravager (1) Complete Challenge: Thadúr the Ravager (1)

deed.name: Great Barrow -- Sambrog Wing
deed.description: The wight-lord Sambrog rules over the Barrow-downs in the name of the Witch-king of Angmar.
deed.objectives: Complete Accursed Fell-spirit (1) Complete Consuming Barrow-crawler (1) Complete Barrow-wights (1) Complete Ancient Flames (1) Complete Sambrog (1) Complete Challenge: Sambrog (1)

deed.name: Known to the Wardens of Annúminas
deed.description: The Wardens of Annúminas know your name and wonder what more you will do for them.

deed.name: Friend to the Wardens of Annúminas
deed.description: The Wardens of Annúminas consider you a friend and are willing to trust you with more important endeavours.

deed.name: Ally to the Wardens of Annúminas
deed.description: The Wardens of Annúminas consider you a stalwart ally and trusted confidant in all things that they do.

deed.name: Kindred with the Wardens of Annúminas
deed.description: The Wardens of Annúminas look upon you as an honorary member of their people. You are welcome among their number and their homes.

deed.name: Known to the Men of Bree
deed.description: Your name is now known throughout the entirety of Bree-land and the people know that you act in their interest.

deed.name: Friend to the Men of Bree
deed.description: All you have done within the bounds of Bree-land has made the folk who live within its bounds friendly to you.

deed.name: Ally to the Men of Bree
deed.description: When Bree is in need of aid the Men of Bree expect that you will find your way to the forefront of battle to assist them in their time of need.

deed.name: Kindred to the Men of Bree
deed.description: You may not have been born among the Men of Bree and you may not make the small towns throughout Bree-land your home, but you are welcome wherever you go.

deed.name: Known to Council of North
deed.description: The last warriors fighting the oppression in Angmar now know your name.

deed.name: Friend of the Council of the North
deed.description: The Free Peoples fighting against the tyranny of Angmar number you among their friends.

trait.name: Council of the North - Travel Discount

deed.name: Ally of the Council of the North
deed.description: In Angmar, the last hope of Free Peoples looks to you to stand beside them among the members of the Council of the North.

trait.name: Council of the North - Vendor Discount

deed.name: Kindred of the Council of the North
deed.description: You have become an important part of the Council of the North, and the Free Peoples of Angmar feel a kindred bond with you.

deed.name: Known to the Rangers of Esteldín
deed.description: The Rangers of Esteldín know your name and have begun to trust you, somewhat.

deed.name: Friend to the Rangers of Esteldín
deed.description: The Rangers of Esteldín respect you and consider you a friendly voice and assistant to their causes.

deed.name: Ally to the Rangers of Esteldín
deed.description: The Rangers of Esteldín look to you for aid against the dangers that they face in the North Downs.

deed.name: Kindred with the Rangers of Esteldín
deed.description: The Rangers of Esteldín consider you to be an honorary member of their number. You are a kindred soul standing beside them on the field of battle.

deed.name: Known to the Iron Garrison Guards
deed.description: The Iron Garrison Guards of Moria now know your name.

title.name: Known to the Iron Garrison Guards

deed.name: Friend to the Iron Garrison Guards
deed.description: The Iron Garrison Guards now consider you to be a friendly face and welcome addition to their efforts in Moria.

title.name: Friend to the Iron Garrison Guards

deed.name: Ally to the Iron Garrison Guards
deed.description: You are now considered to be an ally to the dwarves who make up the Iron Garrison Guards.

title.name: Ally of the Iron Garrison Guards

deed.name: Kindred with the Iron Garrison Guards
deed.description: The dwarves of the Iron Garrison Guards now consider you to be one of their own.

deed.name: Known to the Iron Garrison Miners
deed.description: The Iron Garrison Miners of Moria now know your name.

title.name: Known to the Iron Garrison Miners

deed.name: Friend to the Iron Garrison Miners
deed.description: The Iron Garrison Miners attempting to reclaim Moria consider you to be a friend to their efforts.

title.name: Friend of the Iron Garrison Miners

deed.name: Ally to the Iron Garrison Miners
deed.description: Amongst the Iron Garrison Miners of Moria you are now considered an ally to their cause.

title.name: Ally of the Iron Garrison Miners

deed.name: Kindred with the Iron Garrison Miners
deed.description: The Iron Garrison Miners have come to think of you as one of their own in the deep dark of Moria.

deed.name: Known to the Lossoth
deed.description: The Lossoth are an distrustful brood, but you are now known to them, and this could be a good thing.

deed.name: Friend to the Lossoth
deed.description: You have earned the trust of the Lossoth -- even their friendship -- and they now treat you far differently than any other outsider.

deed.name: Ally to the Lossoth
deed.description: The Lossoth no longer consider you an outsider, instead they welcome you as an ally against the many enemies that they face.

deed.name: Kindred with the Lossoth
deed.description: You are now condered to be one of the Lossoth.

deed.name: Known to the Galadhrim
deed.description: In the peaceful lands of the Galadhrim, the Elves who protect the sacred bowers know your name.

deed.name: Friend to the Galadhrim
deed.description: The Elves of Lothlórien now consider you friendly enough to be trusted unwatched throughout the forest.

deed.name: Ally to the Galadhrim
deed.description: The Elves of Lothlórien have come to trust you as an ally.

deed.name: Kindred with the Galadhrim
deed.description: Even the White Lady knows of your efforts and as such you have earned the highest honour among the Galadhrim.

deed.name: Known to the Mathom Society
deed.description: You are known to those hobbits who find the outside world something of wonder, the Mathom Society.

deed.name: Friend to the Mathom Society
deed.description: The Mathom Society appreciates your contributions and considers you a friend to their collection efforts.

deed.name: Ally of the Mathom Society
deed.description: The Mathom Society regards you as more than just a friendly contributor -- in fact, you have become something of a reliable ally.

deed.name: Kindred with the Mathom Society
deed.description: The hobbits, normally a people distrustful of strangers, have come to find you a welcome guest within the Mathom House.

deed.name: Known to the Elves of Rivendell
deed.description: You are now known to the Elves of Rivendell.

deed.name: Friend to the Elves of Rivendell
deed.description: The Elves of Rivendell now consider you to be a friend to them.

deed.name: Ally to the Elves of Rivendell
deed.description: You have done much to earn their respect, and now the Elves of Rivendell consider you to be one of their allies.

deed.name: Kindred with the Elves of Rivendell
deed.description: All you have done for the Elves of Rivendell has earned a sincere bond of friendship that gives you great respect among them.

deed.name: Known to Thorin's Hall
deed.description: You have become known to the dwarves who make Thorin's Hall their home.

deed.name: Friend to Thorin's Hall
deed.description: All know that you are a friend to all who dwell within Thorin's Hall.

deed.name: Ally of Thorin's Hall
deed.description: You are considered a reliable and staunch ally to the dwarves of Thorin's Hall.

deed.name: Kindred to Thorin's Hall
deed.description: Among the dwarves of Thorin's Hall there is no greater honour to earn. You are considered to be as one with the stone.

deed.name: Kindred with the Malledhrim
deed.description: The Malledhrim now consider you one of their own, they will look to you to lead charges against the forces of the Enemy wherever they go.

deed.name: Friend to the Malledhrim
deed.description: The Malledhrim now consider you a friend to their cause and respect you more.

deed.name: Ally to the Malledhrim
deed.description: You are now trusted among the Malledhrim, and with that trust comes an expectation of continued assistance.

deed.name: Known to the Malledhrim
deed.description: As the vanguard pushing evil from Mirkwood, the Malledhrim look for any that will stand with them. You have become known to their leaders.

deed.name: Known to the Algraig
deed.description: The Men who make the wilds their home in Enedwaith have come to know of you.

deed.name: Ally to the Algraig
deed.description: Your continued efforts to aid the Algraig remove their wariness and endear you to them as an ally.

deed.name: Friend to the Algraig
deed.description: You have done enough that the Algraig, normally mistrustful, consider that you are a friend to them.

deed.name: Known to the Grey Company
deed.description: The Grey Company has learned that you are willing to aid them, and this heartens them some.

deed.name: Kindred with the Algraig
deed.description: You have grown close to the Algraig, and they consider you to be a welcome member of their people.

deed.name: Ally to the Grey Company
deed.description: The Grey Company has come to rely upon you in matters that aid their cause. They consider you a reliable and able ally.

deed.name: Friend to the Grey Company
deed.description: Your continued efforts to aid the Grey Company endears you to them as a friend.

deed.name: Kindred with the Grey Company
deed.description: You are considered to be a member of the Grey Company should you choose or would that they were allowed to take you. Still, the respect you have earned cannot be matched.

deed.name: The Odiferous
deed.description: The Stoors of Maur Tulhau pride themselves as farmers, using only the finest boar-droppings as fertilizer and marigolds around their gardens to ward off pesky animals.

deed.name: Master of Stairs
deed.description: The road leading to Nar's Peak is a long and arduous one.
deed.objectives: Ascend the stair to Nár's Peak Reach the top of the stairs to Nár's Peak

deed.name: Exiles from the Lonely Mountain
deed.description: When Smaug threw down the dwarves of Erebor, Thrór and his family and many of their subjects escaped south, eventually crossing through Dunland and north to the Blue Mountains.

deed.name: The Long Road of the Hobbits
deed.description: It is said that the hobbits of the Shire originated east of the Misty Mountains and that after crossing the Misties, a family of Stoors settled in Enedwaith.

deed.name: Little Wonders
deed.description: While patrolling the Gloomglens, you were amazed to find items clearly belonging to hobbit-folk, however rustic.
deed.objectives: Find a hobbit-arrow in the Gloomglens Find hobbit-boots in the Gloomglens Find a hobbit-bucket in the Gloomglens Find a hobbit-skeleton in the Gloomglens Find a hobbit-pick in the Gloomglens Find a hobbit-bow in the Gloomglens

deed.name: Fisher-king
deed.description: While most of the Stoors of Maur Tulhau are master farmers and expert hunters, a few choose to make their living fishing.

deed.name: The Haunted Burrow
deed.description: The Haunted Burrow offers a wide array of activities.
deed.objectives: Complete Roaring Maw in the Haunted Burrow (1) Complete A Race Through the Haunted Burrow (1) Complete Wailing in the Haunted Burrow (1) Complete The Great Hobbit Rescue (1) Complete A Riddle in a Bottle (1) Complete Rattling Bones in the Haunted Burrow (1) Complete Valuables Gone Astray (1)

deed.name: Gwiber-slayer
deed.description: Defeat gwiber in Enedwaith.

deed.name: Gwiber Slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many gwiber in Enedwaith.

deed.name: Giant-slayer
deed.description: Defeat giants in Enedwaith.

deed.name: Giant Slayer (Advanced)
deed.description: Defeat many giants in Enedwaith.

deed.name: The Up-and-Comer
deed.description: By completing a great number of tasks, you are earning a reputation as someone with a 'can do' attitude and tolerant spirit.

deed.name: The Go-getter
deed.description: By completing a great number of tasks, you are earning a reputation as someone with a 'can do' attitude and tolerant spirit.

deed.name: Ambassador to the Elves
deed.description: There are many Elves throughout Middle-earth, and you have begun a journey to know them all.

deed.name: World Renowned
deed.description: You are working towards becoming a hero to all in Middle-earth.

deed.name: Mysterious Relics
deed.description: Mysterious relics of unknown origin have appeared throughout Middle-earth, but for what purpose?
deed.objectives: Find a mysterious relic somewhere within Middle-earth (1) Find a mysterious relic somewhere within Middle-earth (1) Find a mysterious relic somewhere within Middle-earth (1) Find a mysterious relic somewhere within Middle-earth (1) Find a mysterious relic somewhere within Middle-earth (1) Talk to Barliman Butterbur at The Prancing Pony Inn

deed.name: Honoured Yule-friend
deed.description: You must complete a number of quests for the people of Winter-home during the Yule Festival.
deed.objectives: Complete quests in Winter-home for the Yule Festival (30)

deed.name: Raining Snowballs
deed.description: Win the snowball-fight many times.
deed.objectives: Win the snowball-fight (easy) ($NUMBER$/$TOTAL$) (15) Win the snowball-fight (hard) ($NUMBER$/$TOTAL$) (5)

deed.name: A Monstrous Feast
deed.description: You must complete the full eating contest several times.
deed.objectives: Finish all courses in the Eating Contest (15)

deed.name: Such Generosity!
deed.description: You are a wonderful person! So selfless! So generous! So good!
deed.objectives: Donate your hard-earned rewards to beggars (10)
